Otis and Daniels talk about Daniels' early career and his comedy routine (Leroy & Skillet).

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Program 97

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Chuck Berry, Huey "Piano" Smith, Little Richard, Koko Taylor, Albert King, Los Indios Trabajaras, Lowell Fulson, Aretha Franklin, Screamin' Jay Hawkins, Johnny Otis, Four Tops, Ernie K-Doe, Jimmie Lunceford, Buster Brown, Wilson Pickett, and The Teen Queens. Otis and friends talk about the next records, followed by a comedy segment.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of B.B. King, Gladys Knight, Temptations, Charles Brown, Dominoes, Dinah Washington, Coasters, Dixie Hummingbirds, Helen Humes & Pete Brown, Marvelettes, Jay McShann, Louis Jordan, Preston Love, Supremes, Otis Redding, Percy Mayfield, Sam & Dave, Jimmy Reed, Little Joe Blue, Ravens, Count Basie, Duke Ellington, Slim Harpo, Fats Domino, Howlin' Wolf, Barbara George, and Ben Webster.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Revue Live at Winterfaire

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Live performance by the Johnny Otis Revue: Get Ready -- L.A. Sweetest Place I Know -- Soothe Me -- When Something is Wrong With My Baby -- Willie & the Hand Jive -- I Pity the Fool -- Harlem Nocturne -- Take the A Train -- I Wish -- Stormy Monday Blues -- Stand By Me -- Medley -- Shuggie's Boogie.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Program 98
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Dr. Charles White

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Frankie Lymon & The Teenagers, Aretha Franklin, Percy Mayfield, Four Tops, Temptations, Sam Cooke, Dell Vikings, Sam & Dave, Slim Gaillard, Guitar Slim, Irma Thomas, Little Richard, Otis Redding, Fats Waller, Louis Jordan, Thurston Harris, Charles Brown, and Meade Lux Lewis. Otis talks to Dr. Charles White (aka Dr. Rock), about his official biography of Little Richard.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Billie Holiday, Don & Dewey, Amos Milburn, Clifton Chenier, Martha & The Vandellas, Robert Johnson, Dominos with Jackie Wilson, Ike & Tina Turner, Little Richard, Linda Hopkins, Count Basie with Helen Humes, and Mercy Dee. Otis and White talk more about Little Richard.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Program 99, Christmas Eve Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Little Richard, Charles Brown, Tommy Tucker, Koko Taylor, Bull Moose Jackson, Drifters, Bob B. Soxx & Blue Jeans, Lightnin' Hopkins, Son House, Duke Ellington, Clarence "Frogman" Henry, Dominoes, Jesse Ed Davis, Dinah Washington, Five Keys, Chuck Berry, Elmore James, Louis Jordan, Bobby Bland, Joe Tex, Mahalia Jackson & Lionel Hampton, and Louis Armstrong reading "The Night Before Christmas." Otis and friends talk about Lonnie Johnson and other artists who had big lulls in their careers, and Otis takes phone calls.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Fats Waller, Otis Redding, Joe Liggins, Big Maybelle, Temptations, Count Basie, Shuggie Otis, Johnny Otis & Mel Walker, Bo Diddley, Bessie Smith, Billie Holiday, Martha & The Vandellas, Amos Milburn, Fats Domino, Charles Brown, and Mahalia Jackson. Otis and friends talk about upcoming concerts, Otis describes how his old band used to learn songs, then takes phone calls.
Tape 3: Brief segment with Otis and call-in listeners wishing each other a Merry Christmas.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Program 100, New Year's Eve Party
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bull Moose Jackson, Bob Epstein

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of The Four Tops, Brook Benton, Richard Berry, Big Mama Thornton, Bull Moose Jackson, Preston Love, Sam & Dave, LaVern Baker, Ray Charles, Percy Mayfield, Duke Ellington, Pee Wee Crayton, Esther Phillips, and Dixie Hummingbirds. Otis and Jackson talk about Jackson's early musical experience, how he got his nickname, Central Avenue memories, how he got started in music, "Ten Inch Record" and cover versions, Lucky Millinder, and Henry Glover. Otis and Bob Epstein talk about big band music and its potential for a comeback.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Jimmie Lunceford, Louis Armstrong, Big Bill Broonzy, Drifters, Louis Jordan, Chuck Berry, Cab Calloway, Velvetones, Clarence "Frogman" Henry, Count Basie, Falcons, Bob Howe, Little Junior Parker, Tony Allen, Dinah Washington, Lonnie Johnson, Olympics, Bobby Bland, Aretha Franklin, Wilson Pickett, and Joe Tex. Otis and friends talk about Gregory Hines and the movie "The Cotton Club."

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Roy Milton, Joe Liggins, Johnny Otis Show, Screamin' Jay Hawkins, Clifton Chenier, Sam Cooke & The Soul Stirrers, Nat King Cole, Lowell Fulson, Dirty Dozen Brass Band, B.B. King, Hank Ballard, Chantels, Eddie "Cleanhead" Vinson, Little Esther & Bobby Nunn, Barbara Morrison & Charles Williams.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Little Jimmy Scott, Ray Charles, Count Basie, Drifters, Slim Harpo, Son House, Wynonie Harris, Bo Diddley, Lightnin' Hopkins, Swan Silvertones, Billie Holiday, Professor Longhair, and Fats Domino.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Etta James Special
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Etta James, Lucius Hughes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1 (EC 10" 2693, 2nd half of show): Otis plays the music of Wilbert Harrison, Chuck Willis, Etta James, T-Bone Walker, Clyde McPhatter, Dells, Arthur Conley, and Lowell Fulson. Otis and Hughs talk about Etta James. James talks about wanting to sing blues instead of jazz as a young girl, discusses who wrote "I'd Rather Go Blind," the musicians on "Roll With Me Henry" and the song's huge impact, how The Peaches and Etta got their stage names, and James's audition for Otis. Otis and James take phone calls, then talk more about "Roll With Me Henry," the songs "Security" and "At Last," the current state of their musical careers, recording together, how great singers interpret songs in their own way, the song "I Just Want to Make Love to You," and their dislike of some current popular music styles.

Tape 2 (EC 10" 2694, 1st half of show): Otis plays the music of Chuck Berry, Louis Jordan, James Cotton, Christine Cattrell, Elmore James, Betty Wright, Marvin & Johnny, Bull Moose Jackson, Katie Webster, Barrett Strong, Ruth Brown, T-Bone Walker, Gladys Knight, Charles Brown, Big Joe Turner, Inez Foxx, Temptations, Dyke & The Blazers, Carla Thomas, Huey Smith & The Clowns, and Five Blind Boys. Otis discusses a riot at a recent festival, his talent search, why he only wants Black singers in his band, and takes phone calls. Closes with Redd Foxx comedy segment.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Little Esther Phillips Tribute
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Floyd Dixon, Chick Willis, Bernie Pearl, Long Gone Myles, Barbara Morrison

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Chuck Berry, Olympics, Little Willie John, Clyde McPhatter & The Drifters, Roy Milton, Jimmy McCracklin, Little Esther, Duke Ellington, Coasters, Big Maybelle, Marvelettes, Robert Johnson, Lionel Hampton, Lightnin' Hopkins, Jimmy McGriff, and Long Gone Myles. Otis talks about Little Esther, Jimmy Blanton, Robert Johnson, and takes phone calls. Otis talks to Bernie about his blues shows, long forgotten or ignored artists, and how Otis first met Floyd Dixon.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Chick Willis, Floyd Dixon, Count Basie, Billie Holiday, Sam Cooke, Fiestas, Chuck Willis, Joe Liggins, James Brown, Esther Phillips, Jack McVay, Jay McShann, and Wilson Pickett. Live performances by Floyd Dixon, Chick Willis, Bernie Pearl, Long Gone Myles, and Barbara Morrison ("Going Down to Dallas," "Long Distance Call," "Sweet Home Chicago," "Baby You Don't Live Here Anymore," and "Boogie Woogie Blues"). Willis talks about his brother and parents, where he's from, his early musical experiences. Otis tells the story of how Little Arthur Matthews got his start. Dixon talks about what current projects and his new record, "Fine, Fine, Fine." Otis talks about yesterday's performance at the Los Angeles Street Scene music festival featuring James Brown (Sept. 29, 1985? and takes phone calls.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Central Avenue Revisited
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Dootsie Williams, Buddy Collette

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis talks with jazz musician Buddy Collete and Dootsie Williams, owner of DooTone Records, about the importance of L.A.'s Central Ave. district. Topics include: Black newspapers, how Colette was inspirited to play by Williams, the "Central Ave Breakdown" concert, Williams' bio, Redd Foxx, recording The Penguins hit "Earth Angel," big bands, Colette's early musical experiences, Charlie Mingus, string bass replacing the tuba, house parties, older musical role models, music discipline at the Central Ave. clubs, Pasadena musicians, L.A.'s social climate, comparison of Watts and Central Ave., young musicians not knowing the roots, playing in Otis' band, Black artists' musicality, producers' duty to preserve culture, racism, Calvin Jackson, and the impact of Central Ave on New Yorker musicians.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Program 101
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Brad Kay

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Larry Williams, Joe Liggins, Duke Ellington, Sam & Dave, Fats Domino, Dinah Washington, and Big Joe Turner.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Big Joe Turner, Chuck Berry, Brad Kay, Ray Charles, Count Basie, B.B. King, Harmonizing Four, Jimmie Lunceford, Billie Holiday, Johnny Otis, Little Esther, and Eddie "Cleanhead" Vinson. Otis and stride pianist Brad Kay talk about his musical influences and introduce records. Kay gives a live performance.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show Program 102
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Jessie Ed Davis & Band, Chick Willis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Chuck Berry, Duke Ellington, Marvelettes, Muddy Waters, Wilson Pickett, Four Tunes, Lil Green, Chick Willis, Redd Foxx, Count Basie and Lester Young, Sonny Till and the Orioles. Otis discusses recording techniques for big bands, talks with Chick Willis about his new record.
Tape 2: Live performance by Jessie Ed Davis Band. Comedy segments. Otis plays the music of Eddie Floyd, Richard Berry, Clyde McPhatter, Joe Houston, Sam Cooke, Stevie Wonder, and Nat King Cole.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Central Avenue Revisited
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Clarence Landry, Caroline Richardson, Patsy Hunter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis talks with dancer Clarence "Frenchie" Landry, singer-choreographer Patsy Hunter, and Caroline Richardson about the importance of L.A.'s Central Ave. district. Topics include: working with Count Basie and the "zoot suit" story; positive impact of good role models; Central Ave in the past and the present, discipline and professionalism in the old days, and characters and personalities who lived and worked on Central Ave.; how Landry got into show business, integration and social aspects, and the many stars who would not visit the Avenue; changes during and after WWII; Strut Mitchell and his children; Black music not getting proper credit and lack of artistry in today's music; most famous L.A. bands in the 1930s; Mickey Cohen and L.A. cops who walked the beat; Sonny Love, Billy Love, Preston Love, Uncle Blue, and other personalities from early days; boundaries of the Black community at that time; and some little-known L.A. clubs.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Central Avenue Revisited
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Calvin Bailey, Bob Barber, James Tolbert , Lillian Cumber

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis talks with artist Calvin Bailey, bail bondsman Bob Barber, entertainment attorney James Tolbert, and writer/talent agent Lillian "Lil" Cumber about the importance of L.A.'s Central Avenue district. Topics include: how L.A. in the past compares to L.A. of today physically and culturally; first impressions of Central Ave. and pseudo-integration problems; Dr. Henderson and Dr. Baker; Lee Young, Lester Young, and Count Basie; Dr. Wright and Father Divine; cafes, restaurants, and Jefferson High School; Club Alabam, Turban Room, Jungle Room, the original Barrelhouse, and Watts Towers; WWII influences and Watts migration; hustlers, attorneys, and other notables; the Barnstormers and other sports personalities; cavalcade of jazz festivals; Carlotta Bass, Mr. Bass, the earthquake of 1933, and the California Eagle newspaper; Eddie Beal and other famous music teachers on Central Ave.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Henry Butler, Papa John Creach, Bernie Pearl, Nicky Otis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Stevie Wonder, Temptations, Lightnin' Hopkins, Martha & The Vandellas, Ernie Andrews, Wynona Carr, Champion Jack Dupree, Lionel Hampton, Billie Holiday, Sonny Terry, Mary Wells, Eddie "Cleanhead" Vinson, Lil Green, Junior Parker, Johnny Ace, Aretha Franklin, Impressions, Etta James, Bill Doggett, and Connie Francis. Otis and friends take phone calls, promote an upcoming blues gig in Santa Monica and the Landmark Church's food drive for the homeless in L.A.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of The Four Tops, Charles Brown, Coasters, Sam Cooke, Johnny Otis Show featuring Delmar Evans and Joe Turner, Mercy Dee, Lowell Fulson, Marvin Gaye, Elmore James, Louis Jordan, Lloyd Glen, Ray Charles, Count Basie, and Jesse Belvin. Live performances by Henry Butler, Papa John Creach, Bernie Pearl, and Nicky Otis. Otis and Pearl talk about upcoming concert with Papa John Creach and Eddie Vinson.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Dewey Terry, Johnny Harris, Bernie Pearl, Terry Derrone

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Chuck Berry, Marvin Gaye, Impressions, Lloyd Price, Jimmy Reed, Ray Charles, Aretha Franklin, Little Willie John, Carla Thomas, Bobby Day, Lil Green, Duke Ellington, Roscoe Gordon, Highway Q.C.'s, Dubs, Joe Turner & Elmore James, Gene & Eunice, King Curtis, Charles Brown, and Big Mama Thornton. Otis and Pearl talk about an upcoming gig with Screamin' Jay Hawkins and Etta James, then Otis takes phone calls. Otis and Harris talk about the old days, what Harris is doing currently, his hometown, and mutual friends. Otis promotes the first annual Red Beans and Rice Festival.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of El Dorados, Barrett Strong, Cats & The Fiddle, Count Basie, Don & Dewey, Johnny Otis, Mickey & Sylvia, Art Tatum, Mercy Dee, Clarence Fountain & The Five Blind Boys, Soul Stirrers, Billie Holiday, Nat Cole, Dominos, Faye Adams, Coasters, and Johnny Taylor. Otis and Harris talk about The Cats & The Fiddle and the old days in Los Angeles and New York. Otis talks about how he first met Sylvia of Mickey & Sylvia. Otis takes phone calls, promotes food drive for the homeless and upcoming gigs.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Nate the Great

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Bobby Day, Richard Berry, Little Milton, Albert King, Fiestas, Smokey Hogg, Vernon Green & The Medallions, Ted Taylor, Johnny Otis featuring Shuggie Otis, Cadillacs, Orioles, Wilson Pickett, Jimmy Witherspoon, and Hank Williams. Otis promotes an upcoming gig, the Watts Towers Festival, and then takes phone calls.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Ritchie Valens, Bobby Day, Richard Berry, Elmore James, Big Mama Thornton, Jimmy Reed, Johnny Temple, Clarence "Frogman" Henry, Fats Waller, Staple Singers, T-Bone Walker, and Johnny Otis featuring Little Esther. Live performance by blues musician Nate the Great (b. 1926) on clarinet and button accordion. Otis and Nate talk about his name, working as a blues musician pre-1945, how blues fell out of favor, and getting back into the blues in 1980. Nate then plays "name that tune" with Otis and the studio staff.

King, Maxine Brown, Barbara Lewis, King Curtis, Aretha Franklin, Lester Young, Duke Ellington, Buster Brown, Jimmy and Mama Yancy.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Solomon Burke

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Junior Walker, Turbans, Lloyd Price, LaVern Baker, Neville Brothers, Buddy Johnson, Lil Green, Coasters, Brook Benton, Lightnin' Hopkins, Mary Wells, Teen Queens, Ritchie Valens, Bo Carter, Illinois Jacquet, Impressions, Robert Johnson, Ray Charles, and Mahalia Jackson. Otis talks about Ray Charles and Robert Johnson.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Mahalia Jackson, Billie Holiday, Temptations, Sam & Dave, Duke Ellington, Big Joe Turner, Louis Jordan, Fats Domino, Etta James & Eddie "Cleanhead" Vinson, Solomon Burke, Count Basie, Little Willie John, Jimmie Lunceford, Johnny Otis Show & Shuggie Otis. Otis and Solomon Burke discuss Burke's music and influences, recording music in the 1930s-1950s, and take phone calls.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Lowell Fulson, Billy Foster

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Johnny Otis, Billie Holiday, Lowell Fulson, Impressions, Jimmie Lunceford, Otis Redding, Ritchie Valens, Chuck Berry, Ella Johnson, and Harmonizing Four. Otis and guests talk about the current state of Black music, recording songs in the old days, how Fulson found Ray Charles and how he came up with "Lady in the Rain" and "Tramp." Fulson talks about being raised on an Indian reservation, the first blues song he ever heard, the influence of Lightnin' Hopkins, the future of the blues, his song "Talkin' Woman," baseball, and Little Esther Phillips. Otis and guests take phone calls.

King. Otis talks about Soul Sisters and the death of Eddie "Lockjaw" Davis.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Big Maybelle, Johnny Otis & Joe Turner, Louis Jordan, Caravans, T-Bone Walker, Ike & Tina Turner, Inez Fox, Ray Charles & Margie Hendricks, Tito Puente, Annie Laurie, Shirley & Lee, Little Esther, Barbara Morrison, Big Mama Thornton, Jack McVay, Billie Holiday, Howlin' Wolf, Sarah Vaughan, Wilson Pickett, Dionne Warwick, Dizzy Gillespie, Memphis Slim, Bukka White & Washboard Sam, Count Basie, Barbara Lewis, and Amos Milburn. Otis and Rothstein promote the Landmark Church's food drive and take phone calls.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Charles Williams, Johnny Otis, Sailor Boy, Muddy Waters, Swan Silvertones, Penguins, Brenton Wood, Miriam Makeba, and Gladys Knight & The Pips. Otis and Barbara Morrison talk about how the song "I Want to Come Over" was written and recorded, how she was discovered, losing contact with Sailor Boy, and the song "Every Beat of My Heart." Otis and Morrison take phone calls.

Otis and Clora Bryant talk about her new album and her hometown, how she got started, and their first gig together.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Linda Hopkins & Clora Bryant, Sam & Dave, Johnny Taylor, Billy Williams Orchestra ft. Clora Bryant, Johnny Otis, Joe Tex, Muddy Waters, Paul Williams, Etta James, Little Willie John, Arthur Prysock & Count Basie, Otis Redding, Aretha Franklin, Billy Williams & Clora Bryant, Charles Williams & Clora Bryant, Varetta Dillard, and Jimmie Lunceford. Otis and Bryant take phone calls, then talk about Bryant's earliest musical inspiration, Sweets Edison, arrival in L.A., women instrumentalists they knew in L.A., and DJ Bubba Johnson.

Tape 1: Klugman plays the music of Chuck Berry, Johnny "Guitar" Watson, Louis Jordan, Little Richard, Slim & Slam, Jackie Brenston, Ray Charles, Buddy Holly, Everly Brothers, Count Basie, Duke Ellington, Robert Johnson, Jimmy & Mama Yancey, Fats Domino, Lee Dorsey, Huey "Piano" Smith, Marvin Gaye, and Little Willie John. Klugman promotes a Harold Battiste concert.

Tape 2: Klugman plays the music of The Swan Silvertones, Elvis Presley, Jerry Lee Lewis, Sam Cooke, Tiny Bradshaw, Sonny Ace & The Twisters, Saunders King, Ivory Joe Hunter, James Brown, Cleftones, Diamonds, Joe Jones, Otis Redding, Chuck Berry, Ann Peebles, Freddie King, Chimes, Snooks Eaglin, Lloyd Price, Aretha Franklin, and Spaniels. scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of The Chords, Oscar Tony Jr., Ike & Tina Turner, Four Tops, Four Clefs, Ray Charles, Jimmie Lunceford, B.B. King, Clara Ward, Supremes, Aretha Franklin, Jack McVay, Mercy Dee, and Wilson Pickett. Otis and friends discuss rare records, Otis interviews Jimmy Keyes (The Chords) via telephone, Otis and Soesman take calls.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Wilson Pickett, Sam & Dave, Del Vikings, Channels, Clara Ward, Dinah Washington, Solomon Burke, Frankie Lymon & The Teenagers, Doves, Count Basie, Don & Dewey, Little Walter, Fats Waller, Lightnin' Hopkins, Snooks Eaglin, and Jimmy Reed. Otis and Ron Rothstein promote their food drive to feed the homeless.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Jimmy Reed, Muddy Waters, Joe Turner & Pete Johnson, Ray Charles, Brook Benton, Chuck Berry, Buster Brown, Richard Berry, Clara Ward, Duke Ellington, Martha & The Vandellas, Dakota Staton, and J. Otis.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Dewey Terry, Johnny Harris, Nicky Otis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Junior Walker & The All-Stars, LaVern Baker, Joe Turner, Coasters, Ivory Joe Hunter, Tommy Tucker, Blind Lemon Jefferson, Arthur Conley, Little Esther Phillips, Big Maybelle, Z.Z. Hill, Supremes, Staple Singers, Ann Young, B.B. King, Albert Ammons, and Louis Jordan. Otis and friends talk about the new Three Tons of Joy, take phone calls, and discuss Blue Note Records.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Dinah Washington, Sticks McGee, Four Tops, Stevie Wonder, Don & Dewey, Staple Singers, Supremes, Count Basie, Jesse Belvin, Billie Holiday, and Aretha Franklin. Otis plays pre-recorded conversation with Soupy Sales. Live performances by J. Otis, Terry, Harris, and Nicky. Otis and Terry talk about the new Don & Dewey record. Otis promotes food drive for the homeless.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Performers with the Names of U.S. Presidents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Wilson Pickett, Stevie Wonder, Jimmie Liggins, Frankie Ford, Dinah Washington, Roosevelt Sykes, Bo Carter, Slim Harpo, Temptations, Aretha Franklin, Johnny Taylor, Pete Johnson & Joe Turner, B.B. King, Drifters, Billy Eckstine, Mary Wells, Peppermint Harris, Big Mama Thornton, Wilbert Harrison, and Clarence Carter. Otis and friends chat and take phone calls. Otis promotes upcoming KPFK All Nations Gospel Festival on Friday, March 20 [1987?].

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Mahalia Jackson, Faye Adams, Jackie Wilson, Koko Taylor, Duke Ellington, Ella Fitzgerald, Bobby Bland, Brook Benton, Muddy Waters, Fats Domino, Bull Moose Jackson, Sam & Dave, Lightnin' Hopkins, Billie Holiday, Al Green, Count Basie, Marv Johnson, Lonnie Johnson, Plas Johnson, Pete Johnson, Ella Johnson, Robert Johnson, and Abby Lincoln. Otis and friends talk about Asian influences in Western music, then take phone calls.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Tribute to Piano Players
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Harmonica Fats, Bernie Pearl, Guitar Shorty, Nicky Otis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Fats Domino, Sam Cooke, Wilson Pickett, Cleo Brown, Little Richard, Huey Smith & The Clowns, Floyd Dixon, Professor Longhair, and Piano Red. Otis talks with Pearl, tells a story about Little Richard, and they discuss upcoming radio specials and concerts before taking phone calls. Otis tells the story of how he signed Iron Butterfly and Canned Heat and then lost them.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of The Coasters, Ray Charles, Little Eva, Spiders, Jimmy Reed, Percy Mayfield, Aretha Franklin, Marvin Gaye, and Louis Jordan. Otis and guests take phone calls. Live performances by Bernie Pearl and Harmonica Fats. Live performance by Otis, Pearl, Fats, Shorty, and Nicky Otis. Pearl tells a story about Big George Smith and Phillip Walker and Otis promotes his Red Beans and Rice Festival.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Harmonica Fats, Guitar Shorty, Champion Jack Dupree, Art Tatum & Joe Turner, Count Basie, Nellie Lutcher, Joe Liggins, and Otis Spann. Otis and guests discuss the origin of "The Dirty Dozens" and perform the song live.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Ted Hayes, Blind Joe Hill, Jimmy Tolbert, Nicky Otis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Camille Howard, Arthur Conley, Dinah Washington, Supremes, Bobby Bland, Bo Diddley, B.B. King, Harmonizing Four, Jesse Hill, Professor Longhair, Little Milton, Erma Thomas, Roy Brown, Lee Dorsey, and Chuck Berry. Otis and Hayes talk his organization to help the homeless, the "Outcry for Justice" protest and other projects.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Shirley & Lee, Billie Holiday, Count Basie, Ray Charles, Young Jesse, Louis Jordan, Dinah Washington, Lowell Fulson, Big Joe Turner, Teen Queens, Prince Dixon, Fats Domino, Ink Spots, Albert Collins, Lightnin' Hopkins, and Martha & The Vandellas. Otis and guests take phone calls, talk about the death of Freddy Green, the work of Lester Young, and Albert Collins.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Martha & The Vandellas, Lloyd Price, and Johnny Otis. Live performances by J. Otis, Hill, and Nicky Otis. Hill talks about where he was raised, his early musical influences and experiences, how he got started in music, and being arrested for auto theft when he was young.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Prince Dixon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Chuck Berry, Red Prysock, Dinah Washington, Otis Redding, Lightnin' Hopkins & Barbara Dane, Louis Jordan, Prince Dixon & The Jackson Southernaires, Billie Holiday, Martha & The Vandellas, B.B. King, Wilson Pickett, Lowell Fulson and Jay McShann. Otis and Dixon talk about Dixon's upcoming Gospel Caravan and other upcoming gospel concerts. Otis takes phone calls.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of The Marvelettes, Bobby "Blue" Bland, Count Basie, Marvin Gaye, Harmonizing Four, Aretha Franklin, Big Three, John Lee Hooker, Percy Mayfield, Ray Charles, Ernie K-Doe, Johnny Otis & Eddie Vinson, Little Richard, Fats Domino, Big Joe Turner, and Johnny Otis with Little Esther. Otis takes phone calls, promotes Prince Dixon's gospel festival, and his food drive for the homeless.
Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Brook Benton, Pine Top Smith, Billie Holiday, and Jimmy Reed. Otis takes phone calls and talks about the upcoming Red Beans and Rice Festival.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Chuck Berry, Lee Dorsey, LaVern Baker, Fiestas, Joe Tex, Charles Brown, Billy Eckstine, James Brown, Ray Charles, and Handicappers Band. Otis and friends talk about Pha Terrell and various programs on KPFK, promote upcoming gigs and take phone calls.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of The El Dorados, Slim Gaillard, Swan Silvertones, Nat King Cole, Louis Jordan, Louis Armstrong & Velma Middleton, Johnny Otis, Wilson Pickett, Coasters, Drifters, T-Lou & His L.A. Zydeco Band, Fontella Bass, Brook Benton and Dinah Washington, Otis Redding, Bessie Smith, and Duke Ellington. Otis takes phone calls, talks about his new album and promotes an upcoming gig. Otis and Rothstein promote the Landmark Church's food drive for L.A.'s homeless.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Duke Ellington, Muddy Waters, Jackie Wilson, Billie Holiday, Johnny Otis, Aretha Franklin, B.B. King, and Count Basie. Otis promotes his new album, his art show, and upcoming gigs.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Billie Holiday Tribute
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Micky Kaplan, John Patton, Barbara Sherrill

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of The Cadillacs, Sam & Dave, Fats Domino, Gladys Knight & The Pips, Silhouettes, Buddy Guy, Coasters, Billie Holiday, Bernie Pearl, B.B. King, Count Basie, Duke Ellington, and Sam Cooke.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Billie Holiday, Sam Cooke, Little Richard, Otis Redding, Aretha Franklin, Sonny Boy Williamson, Jimmy Reed, Five Blind Boys, Amos Milburn, Wilson Pickett, International Sweethearts of Rhythm, J. Otis, Tommy Ridgley, and Maurice Williams & The Zodiacs. Otis and Kaplan talk about Otis' upcoming art show in Kaplan's gallery. Otis and Patton talk about Jimmy Reed and African American artistic expression. Sherrill talks about the radio show she and Patton host on KPFK. Otis talks about the International Sweethearts of Rhythm.
Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Billie Holiday, Ray Charles, Dinah Washington, John Lee Hooker, Slim Harpo, Marvin Gaye, and the Four Tops. Otis takes phone calls.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Chicago Blues Night
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Ted Taylor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Stevie Wonder, Katie Webster, Louis Jordan, Jimmy Reed, Smokey Robinson, Jack McVay, Jazz Gillum, Koko Taylor, Count Basie, B.B. King, Lionel Hampton, Son House, Staple Singers, and Etta James, followed by a comedy segment.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Sonny Boy Williams, Ray Charles, Aretha Franklin, Johnny Otis featuring Big Joe Turner, Muddy Waters, Hank Williams, Howlin' Wolf, Bobby Bland, and Dinah Washington. Comedy segment followed by Otis taking phone calls and greeting Taylor.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Thiam Sy Griots of Senegal, Sonny Boy Williams II, Little Walter, Bo Diddley, and Bessie Smith. Otis and Taylor talk about their livestock and the Red Beans and Rice Festival.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Jimmy Tolbert, Richard Berry, Cameron Turner

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1 (EC10 2402): Otis plays the music of Sam & Dave, Chords, LaVern Baker, Cleftones, Big Mama Thornton, Muddy Waters, Lightnin' Hopkins, Marvin Gaye, Ben E. King, Barbara George, and Cadets. Otis talks about his art show and takes phone calls.

Tape 2 (EC 2403): Otis plays the music of Gene Chandler, Ray Charles, Staple Singers, Dinah Washington, Johnny Otis, Louis Jordan, Jackie Wilson, Etta James, and Chuck Willis. Otis introduces Turner who talks about Radioscope and the "Jackie Wilson Marker Fund" that's being sponsored by Jack Gibson. Otis talks about the staying power of the blues and other classic forms of African American music, then greets Tolbert.

Tape 3 (EC 2401): Otis plays the music of Count Basie & Lester Young, Richard Berry, B.B. King, Howlin' Wolf, Billie Holiday, Staple Singers, Otis Redding and Carla Thomas. Otis introduces Berry, talks to Jimmy Tolbert talk about his uncle, Lester Young, and Berry talks about current projects. Otis and guests talk about big band R&B's current popularity and which Billie Holiday songs Lester Young played on. Otis promotes his food drive for the homeless and announces upcoming concerts.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Richard Berry, Nicky Otis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Ray Charles, Lionel Hampton, Joe Jones, Joe Turner, Amos Milburn, Supremes, Four Tops, Fats Domino, Howlin' Wolf, Louis Jordan, and Peppermint Harris.Otis and friends take phone calls, talk about upcoming concerts and the Red Beans and Rice Festival.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Etta James, Ted Taylor, B.B. King, Clovers, Marvin Gaye, Robins, Little Richard, Mitty Collier, Huey "Piano" Smith, Bessie Smith, Drifters, Charles Brown, Chords, Billie Holiday, Richard Berry, and Johnny Otis. Otis and friends take phone calls and talk about food drive for the homeless. Berry talks about reissuing some of his records.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Richard Berry, J. Otis, Temptations, Jimmy Reed, Duke Ellington, Toussaint McCall, Staple Singers, Aretha Franklin, and Muddy Waters. Live performance by J. Otis, Berry, and Nicky Otis. Otis and Berry talk more about reissuing records.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Ken McKnight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Junior Walker, Big Joe Turner, LaVern Baker, Fats Domino, Four Tops, Aretha Franklin, Slim Gaillard, Lil Green, Ella Fitzgerald, and Louis Jordan.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Howlin' Wolf, B.B. King, Clovers, Sam Cooke, Bessie Smith, Ray Charles, Duke Ellington, Muddy Waters, Swan Silvertones, Billie Holiday, Big Mama Thornton, Wilson Pickett, Johnny Otis, LaVern Baker, Solomon Burke, and Coasters. Otis talks about food drives and the Red Beans and Rice Festival.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Professor Longhair, Robert Parker, Drifters, Gladys Knight & The Pips, Fats Waller, Jimmie Lunceford, Sam & Dave, Otis Redding, Chuck Berry, LaVern Baker, Fiestas, and the Dubs. Otis and friends talk about New Orleans followed by comedy segment.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Junior Walker & The All Stars, Louis Jordan, Roy Milton, Richard Berry, Lightnin' Hopkins, Marvin Gaye, Johnny Ace, Christine Cottrell, Impressions, Swan Silvertones, Erskine Hawkins, Little Willie John, Aretha Franklin, Al Green, Barbara Morrison, Platters, Chuck Berry, Fats Domino, Ray Charles, Jimmie Lunceford, Temptations, Lloyd Price, Jimmy Reed, Count Basie, Joe Turner & Art Tatum, and Eddie "Cleanhead" Vinson. Otis takes phone calls.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Duo Special
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Roy Gaines, Bernie Pearl, Nicky Otis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Wilson Pickett, King Curtis, Albert King, Temptations, Lee Dorsey, Sonny Terry & Brownie McGhee, Ike & Tina Turner, Aretha Franklin, Nat King Cole, Roy Gaines, Bo Diddley, Bobby Day, and Bessie Smith. Otis talks about the theme of the night with Pearl. Gaines discusses his first musical experiences and influences, making music for "The Color Purple" soundtrack with Quincy Jones, and Hank Williams.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Delmar & Margie Evans, Brook Benton & Dinah Washington, Roy Gaines, Ted Taylor, Don Covay, and Lionel Hampton. Live performance by Gaines, Pearl, and Nicky Otis. Otis takes phone calls and promotes his food drive for the homeless.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Esther Phillips & Mel Walker, Shirley & Lee, Duke Ellington, Count Basie, B.B. King, Ruby McCoy, Richard Berry, Etta James, Staple Singers, Billie Holiday, Louis Jordan, Johnny Otis, Sam & Dave, James & Bobby Purify, Otis Redding, and Ray Charles.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Etta James, B.B. King, Jackie Wilson, Veretta Dillard, Dinah Washington, Ted Taylor, Richard Berry, Joe Louis Walker, Joe Williams, Marvin Gaye, Aretha Franklin, Frankie Ford, Snooks Eaglin, Little Esther Phillips, Ruby McCoy, Lionel Hampton, and Slam Stewart & Major Holly. Otis talks about his Red Beans and Rice Festival, upcoming blues concert, and opening of a new nightclub.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Lionel Hampton, Slam Stewart & Major Holly, Little Junior Parker, Bobby "Blue" Bland, Johnny Otis & Don "Sugarcane" Harris, Joe Tex, and Count Basie. Otis takes phone calls on the subject of giving proper credit to Black artists who created blues, R&B, jazz and other music genres. Otis and friends promote their food drive for the homeless.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Count Basie, Bessie Smith, Staple Singers, Fats Domino, Ray Charles, Oscar Brown Jr., Four Tops, Moonglows, Billie Holiday, Drifters, Jimmy Reed, Muddy Waters, Clarence "Frogman" Henry, and Irma Thomas.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Big Joe Turner Tribute
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Norman Harris

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Cadillacs, Chuck Berry, Marvin & Johnny, Little Eva, Impressions, Big Joe Turner, Gladys Knight & The Pips, Wilson Pickett, Lowell Fulson, Etta James, Staple Singers, Mississippi John Hurt, B.B. King, Richard Berry, Bobby Day, Ted Taylor, Louis Jordan, Big Joe Turner & Elmore James, Ray Charles, Martha & The Vandellas, Eddie Floyd, Fats Domino, Aretha Franklin, Jimmy Reed, Irma Thomas, and Drifters. Otis and friends, including Norman Harris of Norm's Rare Guitars, talk about the local Cajun festival and a film about Ernie Andrews followed by a comedy segment. Otis and friends talk about the Red Beans and Rice Festival, ask for volunteers, and Otis takes phone calls.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Drifters, Duke Ellington, Count Basie, Big Joe Turner, Johnny Otis Show, Little Esther & Mel Walker, Amos Milburn, Charles Brown, Muddy Waters, Roy Gaines, Isley Brothers, Bessie Smith, Eddie "Cleanhead" Vinson, Billie Holiday, and Art Tatum.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Roy Gaines, Shuggie Otis, Nicky Otis, Jerry "Nut Pony" Abrams

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Little Richard, John Lee Hooker, Wynonie Harris, Erskine Hawkins, Swan Silvertones, Larry Williams, Billie Holiday, Veretta Dillard, Etta James, Supremes, Solomon Burke, Aretha Franklin, Otis Redding, Tommy Tucker, Ted Taylor, Little Esther Phillips, Duke Ellington, Louis Jordan, Lionel Hampton, Four Tops, and Howlin' Wolf. Otis takes phone calls and asks the audience about their favorite comic.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of the Clovers, Robert Johnson, Ray Charles, Dinah Washington, Richard Berry, Bobby Day, B.B. King, Count Basie, and Marvin Gaye. Live performance by Gaines, Shuggie Otis, Abrams, [and Nicky Otis?]. Otis and Gaines talk about upcoming shows. Otis and guests talk about the homeless and social justice projects.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bernie Pearl

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Aretha Franklin, Brooke Benton, Johnny Otis & Esther Phillips, Jimmy McCracklin, Little Walter, Lionel Hampton, Olympics, Wilson Pickett, Lightnin' Hopkins, and Jimmy Reed. Otis and Pearl talk about Harmonica Fats and his upcoming concert.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Ray Charles, Elmore James, Dinah Washington, Larry Darnell, Sonny Terry & Brownie McGhee, Smokey Hogg, Clarence Carter, Little Junior Parker, Big Maybelle, Count Basie, Joe Williams, and Aretha Franklin. Otis and friends talk about CDs vs. LPs and take phone calls. Otis and Pearl talk about Clarence Carter and his upcoming concert, relationships between African and African American musical forms, and influence of Black artists on country and bluegrass music.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Louis Jordan, Monotones, Sam Cooke, Ivory Joe Hunter, Otis Redding, Bill Doggett, Homesick Jones, Clarence Carter, Robert Johnson, Little Willie John, Four Tops, Five Blind Boys, Billie Holiday, Ray Charles, and Elmore James. Otis and Pearl talk about upcoming concerts and Robert Johnson recordings.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Louis Jordan Night
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bill Wax

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Junior Walker & The All Stars, Don Covay, Louis Jordan, Fats Domino, Little Willie John, Clarence Carter, Drifters, Lightnin' Hopkins, Koko Taylor, Jewel Akens, Albert King, Buddy Johnson, Al Hibbler, James Brown, and Nappy Brown. Otis welcomes record collector Bill Wax and they discuss Louis Jordan, Duke Ellington and pros and cons of CDs and LPs.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Dixie Hummingbirds, Billie Holiday, Bobby Day, Roscoe Gordon, Jimmy Nelson, Lloyd Price, Louis Jordan, Lowell Fulson, B.B. King, Duke Ellington, Count Basie, T-Bone Walker, and Smiley Lewis. Otis and friends continue discussion of records, promote Southern California Blues Society festival and new biography of T-Bone Walker.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Louis Armstrong, Louis Jordan, Ray Charles, Big Maybelle, Marvin Gaye, Aretha Franklin, Billy Wright, Brenton Wood, Wilson Pickett, and Otis Redding. Otis announces upcoming 4th of July concert and requests help with his food drive for the homeless.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: T-Bone Walker Special
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Helen Oakley Dance, Stanley Dance, Chuck Mosely, Charlie Horner, Karen Kaplan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1 (EC10" 2695, second half of program): Otis plays the music of T-Bone Walker, Otis Redding & Carla Thomas, Johnny Otis, Little Willie John, Dinah Washington, Count Basie, B.B. King, Staple Singers, Billie Holiday, Muddy Waters, and Lowell Fulson. Otis and guests take phone calls, talk about Helen Dance's new book on T-Bone Walker, Walker's generosity and the time he gave the stage to Shuggie Otis. J. Otis talks about having to break up his big band in the late 1940s, how current studio "big bands" lack the soul and swing of the originators and discusses Count Basie with Stanley Dance. Chuck Mosley promotes the upcoming "Jerusalem Fest" and gives a live performance of harmonica blues. Otis and friends promote the Landmark Church's food drive for the homeless.

Tape 2 (EC10" 2696, first half of program): Otis plays the music of Jackie Wilson, John Lee Hooker, Louis Jordan with Johnny and Shuggie Otis, Clovers, Pee Wee Crayton, Etta James, Richard Berry, Delta Rhythm Boys, and T-Bone Walker. Otis talks with Horner and Kaplan about The Delta Rhythm Boys. Otis and the Dances discuss T-Bone Walker's records, the shuffle beat in R&B, T-Bone's work with trumpet player Jack Trainer, T-Bone's family, his first encounter with Shuggie Otis, how T-Bone got Johnny Otis to sing for the first time, and how royalties could get confused or went unpaid. Otis and guests then take phone calls.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis takes phone calls, then plays the music of Little Richard, Andy Kirk ft. Pha Terrell, Jimmie Lunceford, Jerry Butler, Marvelettes, Smokey Robinson & The Miracles, Trevor Bacon & Lucky Millinder, King Pleasure, Big Maybelle, B.B. King, Sam Cooke, Otis Redding, Ben E. King, Erskine Hawkins, Louis Jordan, and Ella Johnson. Otis and friends talk about helping the poor and homeless in Los Angeles.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Poncho Sánchez

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Louis Jordan, Little Willie John, Ray Charles, Lee Dorsey, Otis Redding, Amos Milburn, Ben E. King, Aretha Franklin, Sam & Dave, Jay McShann, Willie Mabon, Coasters, Sonny Terry & Brownie McGhee, Dinah Washington, and Joe Turner. Otis promotes an upcoming Jay McShann gig and reads a fan letter.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Dinah Washington, Joe Turner, Barbara Lewis, Silhouettes, Ruth Brown, B.B. King, Koko Taylor, King Curtis, Fats Domino, Bessie Smith, Count Basie, Ray Charles, Staple Singers, Ritchie Valens, Medallions, and Poncho Sánchez. Otis takes phone calls, promotes an upcoming gig and the Landmark Church's food drive for the homeless. Otis and Sánchez talk about Latino music.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Poncho Sánchez, Marvin Gaye, Jimmy Reed, Dizzy Gillespie, Johnny Otis & Johnny Ace, Muddy Waters, Teen Queens, Cadets, and Spaniels. Otis and Sánchez talk about music in the Latin American community, jazz and blues festivals, Gillespie's "Manteka," and Sánchez's nickname "Cat Daddy."

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Joe Liggins Memorial

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Bo Diddley, Marvin Gaye, Otis Redding, Etta James, Brook Benton, Sonny Boy Williamson, Howlin' Wolf, Joe Clovers, Little Milton, Little Junior Parker, Joe Liggins, Cab Calloway, Dorothy Love Coates, Billie Holiday, Lloyd Price, Big Mama Thornton, Little Esther, and Eddie "Cleanhead" Vinson. Otis talks about Joe Liggins and the sound effects on Little Esther's "The Storm," then takes phone calls.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of The Highway Q.C.'s, Ella Fitzgerald, Duke Ellington & Ivy Anderson, Penguins, Gassers, Turbans, Clyde McPhatter & The Drifters, Ruth Brown, Percy Mayfield, Memphis Slim, Sly & The Family Stone, and Joe Liggins & The Honeydrippers. Otis promotes an upcoming gig and other acts coming to town, takes phone calls, reads a fan letter, talks to some friends in the studio, and promotes the Landmark Church's food drive for the homeless.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Memphis Slim & Matt Murphy, Sly & The Family Stone, Joe Liggins & The Honeydrippers, Eddie Taylor, Billy Wright, Big Joe Turner, Dinah Washington, Supremes, Muddy Waters, Swan Silvertones, Z.Z. Hill, Albert King, Aretha Franklin, and Joe Liggins.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: King Records Night
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Barbara Morrison, Jackie Payne

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Little Walter, John Lee Hooker, Five Royales, Lloyd Glenn, Duke Ellington, Count Basie, Temptations, Drifters, Little Willie Littlefield, Lonnie Johnson, Eddie "Cleanhead" Vinson, Big Joe Turner, Annie Laurie, Johnny "Guitar" Watson, and Bill Doggett. Otis promotes the Landmark Church's food drive for the homeless and upcoming gig, then plays an excerpt of a speech by Syd Nathan, founder of King Records.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of James Brown, Wynonie Harris, Billie Holiday, Richard Berry, Ted Taylor, Jackie Payne, Ray Charles, Staple Singers, Ivory Joe Hunter, Earl Bostic, Lula Reed, Marvin Gaye, Aretha Franklin, Hank Ballard, Little Willie John, Barbara Morrison, and Robbie Robinson. Live performance by blues singer Jackie Payne; Otis and Payne discuss "Satisfy You." Live performance of "At Last" by singer Barbara Morrison. Otis takes phone calls, plays recording of Syd Nathan speech, promotes upcoming gigs and food drive.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of T-Bone Walker, Louis Jordan, Etta James, Chuck Berry, Four Tops, Bo Diddley, B.B. King, Jimmie Lunceford, Muddy Waters, Robert Parker, Sam Cooke, James Brown, Bull Moose Jackson, Johnny Otis featuring Barbara Morrison, Coasters, Wynonie Harris, and Billie Holiday. Otis and friends promote an upcoming gig, Morrison takes a phone call and gives advice to caller, Otis plays recording of Syd Nathan speech and takes more phone calls.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bernie Mezco

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Temptations, Louis Jordan, Charles Brown, Jimmy Reed, B.B. King, Monotones, Etta Jones, Richard Berry, Sam & Dave, Ray Charles, Sonny & Brownie, Bobby Bland, Faye Adams, Marvin Gaye, Lowell Fulson, Drifters, Fats Domino, Fairfield Four, and Sam Cooke. Otis discusses rare 78s with record collector Bernie [Mezco?] and takes phone calls.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Chuck Berry, Sonny Till & The Orioles, Muddy Waters, Howlin' Wolf, Clarence "Frogman" Henry, Duke Ellington, Professor Longhair, Aaron Neville, Fats Waller, Wilbert Harrison, Coasters, Etta James, Aretha Franklin, Marvin & Johnny, Joe Tex, Avery Parrish, and B.B. King.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Soul Stirrers, Rufus Thomas, Count Basie, Smokey Robinson & The Miracles, Jackie Wilson, Curtis Mayfield & The Impressions, Midnighters, Otis Redding, Kid Ory & The Creole Jazz Band, Lightnin' Hopkins, Brooke Benton, Delta Rhythm Boys, and Chuck Berry. Otis takes phone calls, talks about food drive for the homeless, and New Orleans.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): John Patton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Eddie Floyd, Young Jessie, The Impressions, The El Dorados, Lloyd Price, Faye Adams, Bo Diddley, Duke Ellington, Count Basie, Little Walter, Elmore James, Clarence "Frogman" Henry, The Clovers, Ruth Brown, Joe Turner & Pete Johnson, and Meade "Lux" Lewis. Otis and Patton talk about the regional differences in Black music. Otis promotes upcoming concerts, Landmark Church's food drive and takes phone calls.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Bobby Bland & Jimmy Reed Tribute
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Ralph Williams

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Maxine Brown, Barbara Lewis, Jimmy Reed, Bobby Bland, King Curtis, Aretha Franklin, Lester Young, Jimmy Yancey, Fanny May & Buster Brown, J. Otis, Charles Williams, Nat King Cole, Barbara Lynn, Frankie Lymon & The Teenagers, Professor Longhair, and Patti Labelle & The Bluebells, among others. Record producer Ralph Williams and Otis talk briefly about reissues and Barbara Lynn.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Big Joe Turner, Arthur Connelly, B.B. King, Lee Dorsey, Nat King Cole, Martha & The Vandellas, Big Maybelle, Ray Charles, Fats Domino, Peppermint Harris, Alex Bradford, Billie Holiday, Elmore James, Al Hibbler, Four Tops, and Jay McShann.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Duke Ellington, Count Basie, Inez Foxx, Aretha Franklin, LaVern Baker, Clovers, Mahalia Jackson, Sam Cooke, Mickey & Sylvia, Five Satins, Supremes, Ritchie Valens, and Tommy Tucker. Otis talks about getting young people to listen to traditional Black music, and about meeting Sylvia [Vanterpool] at the Apollo.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Johnny Copeland, Ronnie Lott

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of The Jaguars, Wilson Pickett, Professor Longhair, Don & Dewey, Dominoes, Muddy Waters, Lowell Fulson, Bobby Bland, Duke Ellington, Staple Singers, Inez & Charlie Fox, Tampa Red, and Four Tops. Otis talks to Copeland about the blues, working together in Europe, his early influences, T-Bone Walker, European audiences, young American audiences, music in the old days, touring, and future plans. Otis and Ronnie Lott, of the San Francisco 49ers, talk about NFL football.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Elmore James, Big Joe Turner, Sonny Til & The Orioles, Bobby Day, Shep & the Limeliters, The Clovers, Little Johnny Taylor, Koko Taylor, Ted Taylor, B.B. King, Fats Waller, Big Mama Thornton, Bull Moose Jackson, and more.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Stevie Wonder, Carla Thomas, the Johnny Otis Show, Lightnin Hopkins, Duke Ellington, Lavern Baker, Jessie Belvin, Dorothy Love Coates, Aretha Franklin, and takes phone calls from listeners.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Junior Walker, Earl "Fatha" Hines, Jimmy Witherspoon, Sonny & Brownie, Coasters, Ruth Brown, Mary Lou Williams, Jimmy Lunceford, Supremes, Howlin' Wolf, Fats Domino, Falcons, Richard Berry, Blind Willie McTell, Johnny Otis, Dominoes, Sam & Dave, and more.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Tom McElhaney

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Bull Moose Jackson, Jessie Hill, Jimmie Lunceford & Lionel Hampton, Wilson Pickett, Aretha Franklin, Inez & Charlie Foxx, Clyde McPhatter, Four Tops, Joe Morris ft. Laurie Tate, Bobby Lewis, Ruth Brown, Stevie Wonder, Ray Charles, Joe Turner, Jimmy Forrest, Fats Domino, Marvin Gaye, Clovers, Orioles, and The Chords.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Little Milton, LaVern Baker, Silhouettes, Marvelettes, John Lee Hooker, Duke Ellington, Coasters, Cadets, Jay McShann, Koko Taylor, Brook Benton, Charles Brown, Jimmy Witherspoon, Big Maybelle, Barbara Mason, Junior Walker, Bobby Bland, and promotes live shows at the San Jose Fairmont Hotel.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Count Basie, B.B. King, Sugar Pie DeSanto, Jimmy McCracklin, Chuck Berry, Marvin & Johnny, Moonglows, Lightnin' Hopkins, Johnny Otis & Little Esther, Peppermint Harris, and Camille Howard.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Tom McElhaney

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Clyde McPhatter & the Drifters, Marvin & Johnny, Chords, Sticks McGee, Falcons, Little Milton, Richard Berry, Chuck Willis, Aretha Franklin, Ray Sharp, Ernie Freeman, Lightnin' Hopkins, Howlin' Wolf, Smokey Robinson & the Miracles, Jimmy Lunceford, Big Maybelle.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Little Richard, Charles Brown, Etta James, Dominoes, Little Willie John, Robert Johnson, Big Mama Thornton, Huey Piano Smith, Muddy Waters, Marvelettes, Jimmy Witherspoon, Jesse Price, and Pine Top Smith.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Live at the Fairmont Hotel in San Jose

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Etta James, Jimmy McCracklin, Elmore James, Little Richard, Ike & Tina Turner, Fontella Bass, Ben Webster, Eddie "Cleanhead" Vinson, Harmonizing Four, Billie Holiday, Louis Jordan, Sam Cooke, Little Milton, Jay McShann, Miriam Makeba, and Bobby Bland. Otis and friends talk about New Orleans and fishing.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Live from the Fairmont Hotel in San Jose
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Veronica Aiken, Doris Worsham

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Etta James, Billy Stewart, Louis Armstrong, Koko Taylor, Lightnin' Hopkins, Louis Jordan, Dinah Washington, Harmonizing Four, Billie Holiday, Jimmy Reed, and Jaguars. Otis talks with Aiken about one of his recent paintings and his visual arts influences, and chats with other guests.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Live at the KPFA Crafts Fair

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Etta James, Jimmy McCracklin, Elmore James, Little Richard, Ike & Tina Turner, Fontella Bass, Ben Webster, Eddie "Cleanhead" Vinson, Harmonizing Four, Billie Holiday, Louis Jordan, Sam Cooke, Little Milton, Jay McShann, Miriam Makeba, and Bobby Bland. Otis and friends talk about New Orleans and fishing.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Aretha Franklin, Bessie Smith, Soul Stirrers, and Billie Holiday, Wilson Pickett, Al Hibbler, Jimmie Lunceford (extensive drop out), Charles Brown, and Bobby Bland. Otis talks to Fairmont manager Klaus Kelterborn and his children, Charles (?) gives a live a capella performance of "Take My Hand, Precious Lord."

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Bobby Bland, Big Mama Thornton, Richie Valens, Ernie Freeman, Dina Washington, Gene & Eunice, Big Joe Turner, Marvin & Johnny, Stevie Wonder, Olympics, Crows, Ray Charles, Bobby Marchand, Irma Thomas, Staple Singers, Koko Taylor, Lightnin' Hopkins, and Ella Fitzgerald. Otis talks to guests at the Fairmont about Frank Zappa.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Live from the Fairmont Hotel in San Jose
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bob Frazier, Tom McElhaney, Jackie Payne

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Little Richard, Wilson Pickett, Aretha Franklin, Shirley & Lee, Marvelettes, Howlin' Wolf, B.B. King, Etta James, Richard Berry, Marvin Gaye, Big Maybelle, Bo Diddley, Martha & the Vandellas, Big Joe Turner, the Chords, Jesse Belvin, Ernie K-Doe, and the Dubs. Otis and guests discuss the blues, the song "Roll With Me Henry," and promote new Fairmont Hotels.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Ernie K-Doe, the Dubs, Soul Stirrers, Billie Holiday, Charles Brown, Fats Domino, Johnny Otis, Temptations, Muddy Waters, Sister Rosetta Tharpe, Eldorados, Tommy Tucker, Duke Ellington, Count Basie, Sam & Dave, Bobby "Blue" Bland, and Champion Jack Dupree. Otis talks with guests and Jackie Payne drops by to sing live.

Tape 3: Tom McElhaney chats with Johnny Otis. Otis plays the music of Champion Jack Dupree, John Lee Hooker, Elmore James, Dominos, Four Tops, Jimmy Reed, Freddy King, Platters, Hank Ballard & the Midnighters, Arthur Conley, Ivory Joe Hunter, Stevie Wonder, Dinah Washington, Little Junior Parker, Ray Charles, Brook Benton, and the Staple Singers. Otis talks to guests at the Fairmont Hotel.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Live From the Fairmont Hotel in San Jose
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bob Frazier, Tom McElhaney

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Louis Jordan, Big Joe Turner, Drifters, Crows, Tony Allen, B.B. King, Lightnin' Hopkins, Bobbettes, Little Eva, Jimmy Lunceford, Jimmy McCracklin, Don Pierce and Joe Tex. Otis and Frasier discuss cartoonist R. Crumb, talk to guests at the Fairmont, and introduce records.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Faye Adams, Ray Charles, Sonny Terry and Brownie McGhee, Pete "Guitar" Lewis, Jimmy Reed, Fontella Bass, Professor Longhair, Drifters, Little Willie John, Maxine Brown, Martha & the Vandellas, Koko Taylor, and Jimmy Witherspoon. Otis, Frazier and McElhaney discuss the Pete Lewis and Fontella Bass singles, rate their favorite records, and interview guests.
Tape 3: Tape 3: Otis closes the show for Northern and Central California. Reel goes on to play a different radio program, "Focus on Women in Music."

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Live from the Fairmont Hotel in San Jose
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bernard Hayes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Fats Waller, Bobby Day, Solomon Burke, Billie Holiday, Duke Ellington, Bobby Bland, Elmore James, Temptations, Sam Cooke, Frankie Lymon,El Dorados, Bobby Bland, Otis Redding, Count Basie. Charles Williams sings "Amazing Grace" live. Otis talks to guests about their favorite Black blues and R&B artists and plays their selections. Administrators from the local museum in San Jose promote an exhibit of Otis's sculptures.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Lavern Baker, Cadets, B.B. King, Coasters, Jimmy Reed, Jimmie Lunceford, Charles Brown, Bo Diddley, Sam Cooke, Big Joe Turner, and Count Basie. Otis and friends talk about Jimmie Lunceford and professionalism in the old days. Otis talks about Charles Brown not getting paid royalties for "Drifter Blues." Otis and friends talk about local upcoming concerts, dogs, and New Orleans music.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Big Joe Turner, Smokey Robinson, Little Richard, Jimmie Lunceford, Professor Longhair, Clyde McPhatter, Roy Milton, Otis Redding, Swan Silvertones, Billie Holiday, LaVern Baker, Bobby Bland, Impressions, and Jimmy Reed. Otis promotes the Landmark Church's food drive for the homeless.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of The Drifters, Jimmy Keys, Brook Benton, Louis Armstrong, Roy Hamilton, Fats Domino, Mills Brothers, Pilgrim Travelers, Billie Holiday, Lightnin' Hopkins, Elmore James, Duke Ellington, Count Basie, Little Richard, and Andy Kirk featuring Pha Terrell. Otis takes phone calls, solicit donations from the audience for food drive for the homeless, and talks about gambling with Pha Terrell and Bill Kinney.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: contents unknown

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Roy Milton Tribute

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brief show segment featuring the music of Roy Milton including "Milton's Boogie," "Red Light" (featuring Johnny Otis) and "Best Wishes."

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Robert McKnight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Ruth Brown, Cadets, B.B. King, Four Tops, Brook Benton & Dinah Washington, Coasters, Little Milton, Fontella Bass, Ramsey Lewis, John Lee Hooker, Little Richard, Etta James, Lightnin' Hopkins, Elmore James, and Lloyd Price. Otis talks with friends.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Lloyd Price, John Lee Hooker, The Drifters, Jimmy Reed, Jimmy McCracklin, Koko Taylor, Fats Waller, Aretha Franklin, Dorothy Love Coates & The Gospel Harmonettes, Billie Holiday, and Stevie Wonder. Otis talks to McKnight about his motivational workshops, followed by comedy segment.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of John Lee Hooker, Fats Domino, Dizzy Gillespie, Miriam Makeba, Richard Berry & The Dreamers, Jay McShann featuring Walter Brown, Lionel Hampton, Big Mama Thornton, Charles Brown, Muddy Waters, Jimmie Lunceford, Art Tatum, Mary Lou Williams, Shuggie Otis, Coasters, and The Five Keys. Comedy segment followed by Otis promo for the Landmark Church's food drive for the homeless.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: KPFK Fundraiser

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Larry Williams, Little Willie John, Little Junior Parker, Bobby Bland, Joe Turner, Jackie Wilson, Dinah Washington, B.B. King, and Elmore James. Otis asks for donations for the KPFK fund drive.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: KPFK Fundraiser
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Shelly Rim, John Patton Jr., Ken McNight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Professor Longhair, Jessie Hill, Ernie K-Doe, Dr. John, Lee Dorsey, Huey "Piano" Smith, Cadets, Ben E. King, Billie Holiday, Champion Jack Dupree, Johnnie Taylor, Clifton Chenier, Joe Tex, Fats Domino, Chick Webb featuring Ella Fitzgerald, Count Basie featuring Jimmy Rushing, and The Drifters. Otis solicits donations for KPFK.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of The Clovers, Ray Charles, Lightnin' Hopkins, Lee Allen, Barbara George, Louis Armstrong, Duke Ellington, Otis Redding, Aretha Franklin, Perez Prado, Clarence Henry, Mahalia Jackson, Coasters, and Four Tops. Otis and Ken McNight talk about the Landmark Church's food drive for the homeless. Otis promotes an upcoming gig and solicits donations for KPFK. Otis and John Patton Jr. talk about his role in the movie "The Color Purple," then Otis talks with jazz drummer Shelly Rim.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Tom McElhaney

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Big Joe Turner, Wilbert Harrison, Teen Queens, Duke Ellington, Billy Ward & The Dominoes, B.B. King, Gladys Knight & The Pips, Billie Holiday, Stevie Wonder, and Koko Taylor. Otis and friends talk about an upcoming music festival in Oakland, Otis's upcoming art book, and cartoons that Otis is making as decorations for his new deli/nightclub.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Lowell Fulson, Johnny Otis, Brenda Boykin, Ray Charles, LaVern Baker, Muddy Waters, Duke Ellington, Johnny Tolbert, and The Shirelles. Otis and friends talk about upcoming Oakland music festival. Otis talks to Tom McElhaney about his Top 500 list and Otis talks about his dog, Pookie.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Live from the Fairmont Hotel in San Jose
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bob Frazier, Tom McElhaney, Curtis Jay

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Opens with the conclusion of Emmit Powell's gospel radio show, then segues into the Johnny Otis Show. Otis plays the music of Stevie Wonder, Shirley & Lee, Ike and Tina Turner, Mary Wells, Brenton Wood, Monotones, Coasters, Little Richard, Katie Webster, Wilson Pickett, Little Walter, Eddie "Cleanhead" Vinson, Chuck Willis, T-Bone Walker, 5 Royales, Muddy Waters and Sly Stone. Otis and Bob Frazier talk about Ike and Tina Turner's early band, promote Denise LaSalle show in Berkeley. Otis talks to other guests including deejay Curtis Jay (KFJC: Santa Clara).

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Sly Stone, Little Milton, Supremes, Dinah Washington, Big Mama Thornton, Joe Turner, Art Tatum, Sarah Vaughan, Ella Fitzgerald, B.B. King, Lightnin' Hopkins, Staple Singers, Billie Holiday, and Sam Taylor. Otis and guests talk about Sly Stone, Dinah Washington, Art Tatum, and compare blues artists.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Live from the Fairmont Hotel in San Jose
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bob Frazier, Tom McElhaney

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Opens with the conclusion of Emmit Powell's gospel radio show, then segues into the Johnny Otis Show. Otis plays the music of Lloyd Price, Ray Sharp, Jimmy McCracklin, Fats Waller, BB King, Ernie K-Doe, Memphis Minnie, Esther Phillips, Etta James, Gene & Eunice, Muddy Waters, Count Basie, and Ray Charles. Otis talks with guests and audience members, tells stories about Fats Waller, and more.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Live from the Fairmont Hotel in San Jose
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Tom McElhaney, George Hood

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Joe Turner, Marvin Gaye, Duke Ellington, and Tiny Bradshaw. Otis talks with George Hood, a nutritionist, in the lobby of the Fairmont Hotel.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Tom McElhaney, Bob Frazier

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Jimmy Reed, Drifters, Etta James, Martha and the Vandellas, Platters, Jackie Wilson, Ernie K-Doe, Fats Domino, Fats Waller, Teen Queens, Junior Walker, Johnny Otis, and Elmore James. Otis talks with guests in between records.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Shuggie Otis, Jackie Payne, Nicky Otis, Bob Frazier

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Hank Ballard & The Midnighters, Four Tops, Sam & Dave, Louis Jordan, Stevie Wonder, Fats Waller, Martha & The Vandellas, Junior Walker, B.B. King, Jimmie Lunceford, Count Basie, Aretha Franklin, and Koko Taylor. Otis promotes upcoming Junior Walker concert.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of The Dubs, Turbans, Lowell Fulson, Jimmy Reed, Soul Stirrers, Billie Holiday, Johnny Otis & Shuggie Otis, Fats Domino, Chuck Willis, Duke Ellington, Marvin Gaye, and Mickey & Sylvia. Live performance by Shuggie, Jackie Payne, Nicky, and Johnny. Otis and friends talk about Mickey & Sylvia, Don & Dewey, and upcoming concerts.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of LaVern Baker, Brook Benton, Little Milton, Frankie Lymon, Don & Dewey, Sam & Dave, El Dorados, Drifters, Dinah Washington, Little Richard, Big Mama Thornton, Eddie "Cleanhead" Vinson, and Dominoes, followed by comedy segment.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Mickey & Sylvia.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Live from the Fairmont Hotel in San Jose
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bob Frazier, Tom McElhaney

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Elmore James, Martha & The Vandellas, Richard Berry, Jesse Belvin, Mary Wells, Sam Cooke, Jimmie Lunceford, Dinah Washington, Preston Love & Shuggie Otis, Shirelles, Lightnin' Hopkins, Count Basie, Professor Longhair, Teen Queens, Amos Milburn, and Clyde McPhatter.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Little Milton, Hank Ballard, T-Bone Walker, Louis Jordan, Bobby Lewis, Bo Diddley, Big Joe Turner, Muddy Waters, Lester Young, Junior Parker, Tommy Tucker, Bobby "Blue" Bland, Staple Singers, Harmonizing Four, and Billie Holiday. Otis and friends chat about the Fairmont Hotel.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Lloyd Price Tribute
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bob Frazier

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Otis Redding & Carla Thomas, Roy Milton, Sam & Dave, Supremes, Lloyd Price, Miriam Makeba, Sam Cooke & The Soul Stirrers, Billie Holiday, Little Richard, B.B. King, Marvelettes, Jimmy Reed, Little Junior Parker, and Drifters. Otis talks about clothing styles when he started out.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Nina Simone, Bo Diddley, Lloyd Price, Big Joe Turner, Jackie Wilson, Elmore James, Bessie Smith, Ben Webster, Barret Strong, T-Bone Walker, Charles Brown, Shirley & Lee, and Spaniels. Otis and friends talk about "One O'Clock Jump" and their Top 10 Blues Songs list.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Eddie Vinson Memorial

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Memphis Slim, Eddie "Cleanhead" Vinson, Ray Charles, Coasters, Sam Cooke, Johnny & Shuggie Otis with Delmar Evans, Clifton Chenier, Sam & Dave, Tampa Red, and the Marvelettes. Otis talks about the life and career of Eddie Vinson.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Live from the Paramount Hotel, New Orleans
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): John DeMers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Aretha Franklin, Wilson Pickett, Bobby Bland, Ray Charles, Barbara George, Count Basie, Fats Domino, Lightnin' Hopkins, Professor Longhair, Chuck Berry, Little Willie John, Ikettes, Louis Armstrong, and Johnny Otis.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Mercy Dee, Bobby Bland, Dixie Hummingbirds, Shep & The Limelights, Dinah Washington, Muddy Waters, Johnny Otis, and B.B. King. Otis talks with Fairmont Hotel spokesperson John DeMers about the Blue Room in New Orleans and the Fairmont Hotel's Send Us the Suds shampoo giveaway.
Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Jimmy Reed, Coasters, Jimmie Lunceford, Hank Ballard, Joe Turner, Clovers, Johnny Otis, Otis Redding, Bobby Bland, and LaVern Baker.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Live from the Paramount Hotel, New Orleans
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): John DeMers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of The Johnny Otis Show, B.B. King, Richard Berry, Billie Holiday, Swan Silvertones, Hank Ballard & The Midnighters, Dinah Washington, Coasters, Fats Domino, and Lionel Hampton. Otis and DeMers talk and discuss the Fairmont Hotel's Send Us the Suds shampoo giveaway contest. Comedy segment. Otis introduces three female fans.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Stevie Wonder, Etta James, Aretha Franklin, Count Basie, John Lee Hooker, Penguins, Pete Rodriguez, Robins, Shirelles, Larry Williams, Dinah Washington, Bobby Bland, Jimmy Witherspoon, Jessie Hill, Saunders King, Sonny Thompson, Coasters, B.B. King, and Ray Charles.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Muddy Waters, Johnny Otis, Delmar Evans, Sonny Boy Williamson, Dixie Hummingbirds, Aretha Franklin, Fats Domino, Louis Jordan, Clyde McPhatter, James Brown, and Roy Milton.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Lightnin' Hopkins, Jimmie Lunceford, Johnny Otis with Charles Williams, Louis Armstrong, Joe Turner, Chuck Berry, Odells, Clarence "Frogman" Henry, Barbara George, Hank Ballard, Dinah Washington with Brook Benton, Staple Singers, Lionel Hampton, and Blind Lemon Jefferson.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Live From the Fairmont Hotel in New Orleans

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Ruth Brown, Joe Jones, Maxine Brown, Sam & Dave, Fats Domino, Ray Sharp, Faye Adams, Ray Charles, Johnny Ace, LaVern Baker, and The Dixie Hummingbirds. Otis tells the story about a mixup in Savannah, GA between Faye Adams and Marie Adams, then talks about Little Miss Cornshucks and LaVern Baker.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of the El Dorados, Jerry Butler, Johnny and Shuggie Otis, Sugar Cane Harris, Carla Thomas, Howlin' Wolf, Professor Longhair, Bobby Bland, Little Willie John, Temptations, Lightnin' Hopkins, Spiders, B.B. King. Otis and guests talk about New Orleans artists.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Jimmie Lunceford with Lionel Hampton Orchestra, Brook Benton, Chubby Checker, Jimmy Reed, Chuck Berry, Otis Redding, Jimmy Liggins, Regents, Mitty Collier, and the Dominos. Otis and friends discuss the importance of older recordings and promote The Johnny Otis band's shows at the historic Blue Room.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Freddie King, Coasters, B.B. King, Little Richard, Louis Jordan, Lionel Hampton, Little Esther, Supremes, Johnny Ace, Little Willie John, Chords, Howlin' Wolf, Cadets, Bobby Bland, Ernie K-Doe, Impressions, Otis Redding, Drifters, Meadowlarks, Soul Stirrers, Louis Armstrong, Muddy Waters, Six Teens, Lowell Fulson, and Bobby Charles.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Jimmy Reed, Ray Charles, Lloyd Price, Solomon Burke, Ike & Tina Turner, Big Joe Turner, Sticks & Brownie McGhee, Billie Holiday, El Dorados, Staple Singers, Barbara George, Professor Longhair, Faye Adams, Aretha Franklin, Z.Z. Hill, Fats Domino, Otis Redding, Frankie Lymon, Silhouettes, and Marvin Gaye.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bernie Pearl, Harmonica Fats

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Marvin & Johnny, LaVern Baker, Marvin Gaye, Amos Milburn, Sam Cooke, Bobby Lewis, Johnny Ace, The Monotones, Lee Andrews & The Hearts, Camille Howard, Lloyd Price, and Billie Holiday. Live performance by Pearl and Fats. Otis, Pearl, and Fats talk about working together and marriage; Otis talks about his dogs; Fats talks about where he's from and says hello to his family; Otis, Pearl and Fats talk about favorite harmonica players.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Smokey Robinson & The Miracles, Little Richard, Chuck Berry, Jay McShann & Charlie Parker with Walter Brown, Miriam Makeba, Jimmy Reed, and B.B. King. Live performance by Pearl and Fats. Otis and guests talk about their radio playlists and the blues legends they feature.

Tape 3: Otis performs live with Pearl and Fats, takes phone calls, and plays the music of Larry Williams, Ray Charles, J. Otis, Percy Mayfield, Count Basie, Ella Fitzgerald & Louis Armstrong, Ben Webster & J. Otis, Lee Dorsey, Richard Berry, John Lee Hooker, Etta James, Duke Ellington, Clovers, Lowell Fulson, and Louis Jordan.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of B.B. King, Lil Green, Little Richard, LaVern Baker, Louis Armstrong and Ella Fitzgerald; Otis and friends chat about next records, play Bo Diddley, and Percy Mayfield.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Jackie Brenston, Memphis Slim, Jay McShann, Ray Charles, Dorothy Love Coates & the Gospel Harmonettes, Billie Holiday, King Curtis, The Ikettes, and discuss Ike Turner.
Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Sam Cooke and Bobby Parker, takes phone calls, plays Louis Jordan, Lionel Hampton, Moonglows, and Duke Ellington.

Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Aaron Neville, Faye Adams, Aretha Franklin, Coasters, Bobby Bland, Charles Brown (with Johnny and Shuggie Otis), Count Basie, Johnny Otis Show, T-Bone Walker, and Johnny Otis Orchestra.

Tape 5: Otis plays "Harlem Nocturne" (end of song); Otis plays the music of Arthur Connelly, Jack Dupree, Ray Sharpe, Guitar Slim, Hank Ballard, Robert Johnson, Stevie Wonder, and Ruth Brown. Promotes food drive for the homeless.

Tape 6: Otis plays the music of the Swan Silvertones, Dinah Washington, Jimmy Witherspoon, Little Junior Parker, Katie Webster, Fontella Bass, Barrett Strong, Bessie Smith, Chuck Willis, and Big Maybelle.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Gene "Mighty Flea" Connors, A Cappella All-Stars

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Jr. Walker & the All-Stars, Lloyd Price, Coasters, Smokey Robinson & the Miracles, Mercy Dee, Johnny Otis feat. Mighty Flea, Aretha Franklin, and Wilson Pickett.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Aretha Franklin, Wilson Pickett, Bobby Bland, Count Basie feat. Jimmy Rushing, Dorothy Love Coates & the Gospel Harmonettes, and the Drifters. Live performances from the A Cappella All-Stars ("Rockin' Robin" and "I'm So Proud") and Gene "Mighty Flea" Connors.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of the Drifters, Ray Charles, B.B. King, Lowell Fulson, Dinah Washington, Stevie Wonder, and Hank Ballard & the Midnighters. Live performance by the A Cappella All-Stars ("Your Love Keeps Lifting Me Higher" and "This is Dedicated to the One I Love"), Johnny Otis, and Mighty Flea.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Stevie Wonder, Hank Ballard & the Midnighters, Elmore James, Ruth Brown, Etta James. Live performance from Johnny Otis feat. Mighty Flea.

Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Johnny Otis, Little Milton, Duke Ellington, Jay McShann feat. Walter Brown, Memphis Slim, Louis Armstrong, James Brown, Heartbeats, Jesse Belvin, and Johnny Otis feat. Shuggie Otis.

Tape 6: Otis plays the music of Jesse Belvin, Johnny Otis feat. Shuggie Otis, Gladys Knight & the Pips, Chuck Berry, Lee Dorsey, Tommy Ridgely, Joe Turner & Pete Johnson, and Bo Diddley. Live performance by the A Cappella All-Stars ("So Fine").

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Featured artists are those with the names of US presidents; Otis plays the music of Big Joe Turner, Clarence Carter, Jackie Wilson, Ike & Tina Turner, Johnny Adams, Roosevelt Sykes, Muddy Waters, Don Gardener, and Frankie Ford.
Tape 2: Featured artists are those with the names of US presidents; Otis plays the music of Lester Young, Robert Johnson, Johnny Taylor, Little Johnny Taylor, Wilbert Harrison, and Duke Ellington.
Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Little Son Jackson, Ray Charles & Betty Carter, Wilson Pickett, and Billie Holiday & Teddy Wilson.

Tape 4: Otis plays the music of the Harmonizing Four, Dinah Washington, Jimmy Reed, Johnny Otis feat. Ben Webster, and Aretha Franklin; Otis and Jimmy Tolbert discuss Harlan Leonard's band, the Club Alabam in the 1940s, Bobby Shad, and Ben Webster.

Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Aretha Franklin, Marv Johnson, LaVern Baker, Norm Harris & the A Cappella All-Stars, Count Basie, and Faye Adams; Live performance from the A Cappella All-Stars ("This Magic Moment" and "My Girl").
Tape 6: Otis plays the music of the Drifters, Joe Turner and Pete Johnson, Lloyd Price, Clarence Henry, the Dubs, Ray Charles, Marvin Gaye & Tammi Terrell, Martha & the Vandellas, and B.B. King.

Otis talks to McCracklin (on telephone) about his new album and upcoming tour dates; Otis and Berry talk about recording "Wait for Me," "Rockin' Man," and "Good Rockin' Daddy."
