did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Hank Ballard & the Midnighters, Four Tops, Big Maybelle, Otis Redding, Jay McShann, Jimmy Lunceford, Jimmy Reed, Miriam Makeba, Ray Charles, and the Clovers.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of the Clovers, T-Bone Walker, Eunice Frost, Johnny Staton, Little Milton, Little Willie John, Huey "Piano" Smith, and Aaron Neville. Otis and friends talk about Southern California Blues Society and upcoming concerts, Otis talks about the time he tried to cross over into the pop market with a Little Willie John song.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Huey "Piano" Smith, Aaron Neville, Paul Williams, Fats Domino, Billie Holiday, Duke Ellington, and Elmore James. Otis and friends discuss ongoing preservation efforts traditional African American music.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of the Coasters, Ike & Tina Turner, Staple Singers, Swan Silvertones, Earl Bostic, Lil Green, B.B. King, and Muddy Waters.
Tape 5: Otis plays the music of B.B. King, Muddy Waters, Saunders King, Marvin Gaye, Johnny Otis, Danny Baker, Charles Brown, Etta James, and Dinah Washington.

Tape 6: Otis plays the music of Dinah Washington, Ruth Brown, Little Esther, Julia Lee, Ella Fitzgerald, LaVern Baker, and Aretha Franklin. Otis talks about the first time he heard Little Esther sing.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Big Maybelle, Memphis Slim, Phineas Newborn, Joe Turner & Elmore James, Dirty Dozen Brass Band feat. Dr. John, Sam & Dave, Gladys Knight & the Pips, and James & Bobby Purify. Otis talks about the passing of Phineas Newborn.
Tape 3: Otis plays the music of James & Bobby Purify, Richard Berry, Slim Gaillard, Faye Adams, Clyde McPhatter & the Drifters, and the Staple Singers. Otis and friends take phone calls.

Tape 4: Otis plays the music of the Staple Singers, Mahalia Jackson, Fats Domino, Aretha Franklin, Billy Eckstine feat. Earl Hines, Billie Holiday, Martha & the Vandellas, Charles Brown, and Gary "U.S." Bonds. Otis and friends talk about Charles Brown.

Tape 5: Otis and friends talk about Charles Brown. Otis plays the music of Gary "U.S." Bonds, Ernie K-Doe, Duke Ellington feat. Ray Nantz, Louis Jordan, Elmore James, Tampa Red, Marvin Gaye, James Brown, and LaVern Baker.

Tape 6: Otis plays the music of James Brown, LaVern Baker, Mary Wells, Chuck Berry, the Coasters, Cleo Brown, Bobby Bland, and B.B. King. Otis talks about seeing Cleo Brown perform at the Filmore when he was young.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Chris Kenner, King Floyd, Moonglows, Rays, Lionel Hampton, Chuck Berry, Joe Turner, and Jackie Wilson. Otis and friends take phone calls.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Junior Walker & The All Stars, The Marvelettes, Ray Charles, Sam & Dave, Etta James, Little Walter, T-Bone Walker, Count Basie, Louis Armstrong, Wilson Pickett, Smiley Lewis, The Sweet Inspirations, Lee Dorsey, Muddy Waters, and Little Richard. Otis and friends talk about New Orleans, tae kwon do, and the current state of Black music and lack of traditional elements.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Aretha Franklin, Al Green, Lowell Fulson, Meade Lux Lewis, Joe Tex, LaVern Baker, Bobby Day, Big Bill Broonzy, and Duke Ellington. Otis talks about Black bands in the old days, how Black music has changed over the years, and the female singers he's featured in his band, then takes phone calls.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Duke Ellington, Billie Holiday, Big Maybelle, Little Willie Littlefield, Gladys Knight & The Pips, Marvin Gaye, Slim Gaylord, Roy Brown, Chuck Berry, Veretta Dillard, Louis Jordan, Johnny Otis, Nellie Letcher, and Otis Redding. Otis promotes an upcoming Doo-wop Society Concert and talks about the R&B Foundation.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Johnny Otis, Little Esther, Little Willie John, Gladys Knight & the Pips, Preston Love, Marie Adams, Illinois Jacquet, Delmar Evans, Fiestas, Big Mama Thornton, Jackie Wilson, and Hank Ballard & the Midnighters.

Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Jackie Wilson, Hank Ballard & the Midnighters, Otisettes, Johnny "Guitar" Watson, Johnny Otis feat. Jimmy Rushing, Johnny Otis, Laura Otis & the Satinettes, Johnny Otis & Marcy Lee, Fats Domino, Louis Jordan, and Aretha Franklin.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Songs Related to Johnny Otis
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Billy Vera, Jerome Bowman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Johnny Otis feat. Shuggie Otis, Robins, Little Willie John, Little Esther, Johnny Otis, and Lester Young. Otis and Vera chat; Otis talks about reception of his release "Double Crossin'' Blues."

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Lester Young, Ben Webster, Etta James, Johnny Otis, Delmar Evans, Shuggie Otis and Little Esther. Otis talks about recruiting Ben Webster for his band, Vera discusses camaraderie between Webster and Pete Lewis. Otis talks about discovering Etta James, the relationship between "Rock Me Baby" and the gospel song "Thank You Jesus," and his album "Cold Shot."

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Little Esther, Little Richard, Sheiks, Johnny Otis, and Von Streeter. Otis and Vera talk about recording for Don Robey's Peacock label, The Sheiks, jazz and bebop, the Leon and Otis Rene record labels, and the Spin label.

Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Little Esther, Johnny Otis, Johnny Ace, Little Richard, and Charles Brown. Otis and Vera talk about drummers from New Orleans, Von Streeter, Charlie Parker, and Johnny Ace.

Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Charles Brown, Jay McShann, Joe Liggins, Willie Mabon, Robins, and the Clovers. Live performance from Jerome Bowman. Otis talks to Bowman about his influences, Otis and Vera tell stories about Joe Liggins and the Clovers song "Devil or Angel."

Tape 6: Otis plays the music of the Clovers, Jimmy Liggins, Nappy Brown, Jerome Bowman, Vera Hamilton, and Christine Cattrell. Live performance from Jerome Bowman. Otis and Vera talk about Jimmy Liggins, Nappy Brown, early members of Otis's band, and upcoming gigs.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bernie Pearl

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Johnny Otis & Eddie Vinson, Nappy Brown, Johnny Ace, Gladys Knight & the Pips, Jimmy Witherspoon, King Curtis, Aretha Franklin, and Clyde McPhatter & the Drifters. Otis talks about working with Johnny Ace and his obsession with guns.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Clyde McPhatter & the Drifters, T-Bone Walker, Otis Redding, Betty Wright, Jessie Stone, Chris Kenner, and Muddy Waters. Otis and Pearl talk about doo wop music and promote the Boatful of Blues Cruise.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Blind Willie Johnson, Charles Brown, H-Bomb Ferguson, Chuck Jackson, Irma Thomas, Mills Brothers, Ravens, Jimmy Reed, Harmonica Fats, Ray Charles, and LaVern Baker. Otis and Pearl talk about Charles Brown and The Ravens first time on stage with Otis.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Ray Charles, LaVern Baker, Jimmy & Jeannie Cheatham, and Barbara Moore. Otis and friends take phone calls.

Tape 5: Otis and friends take phone calls. Otis plays the music of Fats Domino, Little Richard, Hank Ballard & the Midnighters, Sam Cooker, Louie Jordan, Jimmie Lunceford, B.B. King, Billie Holiday, and Count Basie.
Tape 6: Otis plays the music of Count Basie, Bobby Bland, Duke Ellington, and Ike & Tine Turner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Johnnie Taylor, Ray Charles, Little Walter, Count Basie, T-Bone Walker, Lloyd Price, Dinah Washington, and the Clovers.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of the Clovers, LaVern Baker, Big Joe Turner, Charles Brown, Bull Moose Jackson, Lee Dorsey, Ernie K-Doe, Sonny Terry & Brownie McGhee, and Duke Ellington feat. Al Hibbler. Otis talks about recent death of Bull Moose Jackson.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Duke Ellington feat. Al Hibbler, Brad Pie, Etta James, Orioles, Staple Singers, Fats Domino, Rev. Claude Jeter, Billie Holiday, and Robert Johnson. Live blues performances from Brad Pie. Otis talks to Pie about his background.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Robert Johnson, Freddy King, Lil Green, Bull Moose Jackson, Amos Milburn, and B.B. King. Otis and friends take phone calls.
Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Amos Milburn, B.B. King, Aretha Franklin, Jimmy Reed, Louis Jordan, Linda Hopkins, and Jimmy Rogers. Otis talks about discovering Linda Hopkins.
Tape 6: Otis plays the music of Jimmy Rogers, Albert King, the Coasters, Marvin Gaye, Roy Milton, Muddy Waters, Nat Cole, and LaVern Baker.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bernie Pearl, Harmonica Fats, John Patton, Curtis Griffith

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Chuck Berry, Louis Jordan, Otis Redding, Joe Turner, Jimmy Reed, Aretha Franklin, Ray Charles, Sonny Terry & Brownie McGhee, Billie Holiday, and Lil Green.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Lil Green, B.B. King, Tampa Red, Etta James, Elmore James, Koko Taylor, Harmonica Fats, and Bernie Pearl & Harmonica Fats. Live performances by Harmonica Fats and Bernie Pearl.

Tape 3: Live performance by Bernie Pearl and Harmonica Fats. Otis plays the music of Prof. Alex Bradford, Dorothy Love Coates, Louis Armstrong, Julia Lee, Smokey Wilson, Albert Collins, Lightnin' Hopkins, and Tina Turner. Otis and friends talk about Black music of the past and present, then take phone calls.

Tape 4: Otis plays the music of the Coasters, Clyde McPhatter, Fats Domino, and Wilson Pickett. Live performance of "Stormy Monday Blues" by Pearl, Harmonica Fats and Curtis Griffith. Pearl talks about how Griffith inspired him to keep playing the blues.
Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Wilson Pickett, and Johnny Otis feat. Ramona and Jackie Payne.
Tape 6: Otis closes the show.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Count Basie's Birthday
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Brad Pie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Lowell Fulson, Lionel Hampton, Lightnin' Hopkins, Count Basie, Aretha Franklin, Smokey Hogg, Duke Ellington, Slim Harpo, John Lee Hooker, Archie Brownlee & the Five Blind Boys of Mississippi, Al Green, Ella Fitzgerald, Billie Holiday, Lloyd Price, and Otis Redding. Otis talks about poverty and environmental issues.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Otis Redding, Joe Jones, Sam & Dave, B.B. King, James Brown, Count Basie, Charlie Christian, Johnny Otis, Johnny Otis feat. Ramona & Jackie Payne, and Johnny Otis feat. LaDee Streeter.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Johnny Otis feat. LaDee Streeter, Johnny Otis feat. Ramona, Johnny Otis, Smokey Robinson & the Miracles, Marvin Gaye, Gene Krupa, Jimmie Lunceford, Calvin Bose, Little Willie John, Big Maybelle, Percy Mayfield, Bo Diddley, Heartbeats, Count Basie, El Dorados, and the Clovers. Johnny Otis & Brad Pie perform live.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of the Clovers, Floyd Ray, Jimmy Reed, and Ray Charles.

scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Louis Jordan & Johnny Otis, Ruth Brown, Aretha Franklin, Muddy Waters, Jody Williams, Little Walter, Paul Gayten, Fontella Bass, and Al Green.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Al Green, Robert Nighthawk, Big Three Trio, Big Joe Turner, Muddy Waters & James Cotton, Billy Stewart, Koko Taylor, Bo Diddley, Elmore James, Mitty Collier, Jackie Brenston, Dizzy Gillespie, Johnny Otis feat. Ramona, and Lee Andrews & the Hearts.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Johnny Otis feat. Ramona, Lee Andrews & the Hearts, Clarence Henry, Ramsey Lewis, Lowell Fulson, Chuck Berry, Ann Peebles, Fats Waller, Billie Holiday, Hank Ballard & the Midnighters, Bobby Bland, Charlie Parker, Paul Williams, Dominoes, Etta James, Dirty Red, B.B. King, and Joe Liggins.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Duke Ellington, Ray Charles, King Curtis, Otis Redding, Wilson Pickett, Roscoe Gordon, and Jimmy Reed.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Brad Pie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of the Four Tops, Otis Redding, Etta James, Jay McShann, Coasters, Ray Charles, Clovers, Lloyd Price, Dinah Washington, Eddie Floyd, Joe Liggins, B.B. King, Bessie Smith, Brad Pie, and the Fiestas. Live performance from Brad Pie ("Blues in B Natural").

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of the Fiestas, Martha & the Vandellas, Louis Armstrong, Wilbert Harrison, Sam & Dave, Wilson Pickett, Silhouettes, Billie Holiday, Marvelettes, Aretha Franklin, Lee Dorsey, Champion Jack DuPree, Ray Charles, and Slim & Slam.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Slim & Slam, Muddy Waters, Count Basie, Little Willie John, Swallows, Fats Waller, Johnny Otis, Bardu Ali, & Kathy Cooper, Chuck Berry, Nat Cole, Five Blind Boys, Jackie Wilson, and Sam Cooke.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of the Five Blind Boys, Jackie Wilson, Sam Cooke, Gary "U.S." Bonds, Sarah Vaughan, Delta Rhythm Boys, Jimmy Reed, and Hank Ballard & the Midnighters.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Songs with "Love" in the Title
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Terry Carter, Brad Pie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Stevie Wonder, Mickey & Sylvia, Clyde McPhatter, Bobby Bland, Little Junior Parker, Supremes, Drifters, Billie Holiday, Duke Ellington, Little Esther Phillips, Paul Gayten, Muddy Waters, Bessie Smith, Brad Pie, Monotones, and Aretha Franklin. Live performance from Brad Pie ("Blues in E"). Otis interviews Terry Carter (via telephone) about his documentary, "A Duke Named Ellington."

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Aretha Franklin, Johnny Otis feat. Charles Williams, LaVern Baker, Brad Pie, Freddie King, Otis Redding, Don Gardener & Dee Dee Ford, Charles Brown, Ray Charles, Percy Sledge, Big Joe Turner, Sam & Dave, Johnny Otis & Brad Pie, Jimmy Reed, Jerry Butler, and Johnny Otis feat. Mel Walker & Ada Wilson. Live performance from Brad Pie and Otis ("Breakfast Blues" and "Love Makes Me Do Foolish Things"). Otis and friends take phone calls.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Johnny Otis feat. Mel Walker & Ada Wilson, Etta James, Fats Domino, Marvin Gaye, Louis Armstrong, Dizzy Gillespie, Bo Diddley, Preston Love, Dinah Washington, Clovers, Johnnie Taylor, John Lee Hooker, Shirelles, Ruth Brown, Teen Queens, and Jesse Belvin. Otis and friends talk about Pakistani food with the show's engineer.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Brad Pie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Wilson Pickett, Coasters, Joe Turner, Sam & Dave, Jimmy Reed, Preston Love, Joon Yamagichi & Shuggie Otis, Aretha Franklin, Count Basie, Dinah Washington, Preston Love, Lowell Fulson, and Muddy Waters. Otis and friends talk about fishing.
Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Otis Redding and Irma Thomas.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of the Four Tops, Brook Benton, Ella Fitzgerald, Billie Holiday, Clyde McPhatter & the Drifters, Claude Cloud, Chuck Berry, Little Willie John, Esther Phillips, Louis Jordan, Brad Pie, Isley Brothers, Joe Tex, Roy Eldridge, Eddie Vinson & Cootie Williams, Barbara George, and Aaron Neville; Live performance from Brad Pie. Otis talks about discovering Little Willie John and signing him to King Records.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Barbara George, Aaron Neville, and Count Basie.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Irving Berlin Tribute
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): June Yamagishi, Shuggie Otis, Brad Pie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Lavern Baker, Frank Cully, Little Richard, Ray Charles, Drifters, Howlin' Wolf, Muddy Waters, Mills Brothers, Ella Fitzgerald, Bo Diddley, Fats Domino, Temptations, Al Green, Shuggie Otis, and Aretha Franklin. Live performance from Shuggie Otis.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Aretha Franklin, Impressions, June Yamagishi feat. Shuggie Otis, Yamagishi & Bobby Womack, Count Basie, Lloyd Price, Swan Silvertones, Billie Holiday, and Otis Redding. Otis interviews Yamagishi about his recent tour in Japan and how he got started in blues. Live blues performances from Yamagishi and Shuggie Otis.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Otis Redding, Taj Mahal, B.B. King, Silhouettes, Robert Parker, Wild Tchoupitoulas, Joe Turner feat. Elmore James, June Yamagishi, Brad Pie, & Johnny Otis, Jimmy Reed, Gladys Knight & the Pips, Louis Armstrong, Louis Jordan, Cleo Brown, Clovers, Lee Allen, T-Bone Walker, and Julia Lee. Live blues performances by Yamagishi and Pie ("I Heard It Through the Grapevine" and "T-Bone Walker Blues"). Otis talks about upcoming Bernie Pearl show.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Julia Lee.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Food Related Songs
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bernie Pearl, Tony Matthews, Brad Pie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Lloyd Price, Robins, LaVern Baker, Louis Jordan, Edith Johnson, Tony Matthews, Pee Wee Crayton. Otis and Pearl discuss John Collins, Pee Wee Crayton and his version of "Blues After Hours," and talk to Matthews about his background.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Pee Wee Crayton, Marvelettes, Marvin & Johnny, King Curtis, Amos Milburn, Fats Domino, Booker T & the M.G.'s, and Little Richard. Otis talks to Matthews about his musical influences, the state of blues music, and Otis's upcoming album.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Booker T & the M.G.'s, Little Richard, Olympics, Hank Williams, Little Milton, Slim Gaillard, and Jesse Stone. Live performance from Tony Matthews ("Who's Lovin' You Tonight"). Otis and guests promote an upcoming blues concert and share memories of Pee Wee Crayton.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Jesse Stone, Butterbeans and Susie, Eddie Vinson, Four Tops, and Otis Redding. Live performance by Pie and Matthews. Otis and guests take phone calls.
Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Otis Redding, Big Maybelle, Dinah Washington, Billy Eckstine, Swallows, Tony Matthews, B.B. King, and Duke Ellington. Bernie Pearl performs live.
Tape 6: Otis plays the music of Duke Ellington, Billie Holiday, Preston Love & Shuggie Otis, Johnny Otis, Coasters, Nat King Cole, and Louis Jordan. Matthews and Pearl perform live.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Steve Rosier, John Patton, Brad Pie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Hal Singer, Temptations, Lloyd Price, Jimmy Reed, Bobby Bland, Big Joe Turner & Elmore James, Little Willie John, and Jimmie Lunceford.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Jimmie Lunceford, Ray Charles, Ruth Brown, Johnny Otis, Hank Ballard, and Marvelettes. Otis talks about Ray Charles's hit "Don't You Know Baby," how he learned to "roll" on the drums and why.

Tape 3: Otis talks about the importance of traditional music within cultures and about musical tastes today. Otis plays the music of Billie Holiday, Duke Ellington, Fats Domino, Don Gardner & Dee Dee Ford, Robert Johnson, King Curtis, and Chuck Berry.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Chuck Berry, Wilson Pickett, Count Basie, Johnny Otis, Aretha Franklin, and Joe Simon. Otis and friends discuss their favorite trumpet players.
Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Joe Simon, Fats Waller, Slim & Slam, Dixie Cups, and Chris Kenner.
Tape 6: Otis plays the music of Chris Kenner, Little Lester, Louis Jordan, Little Walter, B.B. King, Coasters, and Ink Spots.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Gerald Wilson, Barbara Moore, Brad Pie, John Patton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Jay McShann, Coasters, Otis Redding, Ray Charles, Eddie "Cleanhead" Vinson, B.B. King, Slim Harpo, Chuck Berry, and Little Willie John.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Little Willie John, Four Deuces, Sam & Dave, Staple Singers, Marvin Gaye, and Dinah Washington. Otis welcomes Wilson, who discusses his new album, Lester Young, the Greystone Ballroom, and Edwin Wilcox.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Gerald Wilson, Barbara Moore, Johnny Otis, Swan Silvertones, and Dorothy Love Coates & the Gospel Harmonettes. Otis talks with Gerald Wilson and Barbara Moore about their influences, Wilson's band and their version of "Flying Home."

Tape 4: Otis plays the music of the Swan Silvertones, Dorothy Love Coates & the Gospel Harmonettes, Barbara Moore, Gerald Wilson, and Big Joe Turner. Live performance by Brad Pie and Barbara Moore ("Thinkin' and Drinkin'"). Otis and Wilson discuss jazz musicians who also play blues.
Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Big Joe Turner, Smokey Hogg, John Lee Hooker, Lowell Fulson, and Etta James.

Tape 6: Otis plays the music of Etta James, Gerald Wilson, and Bobby Bland. Live performance segments featuring Johnny Otis with Gerald Wilson. Otis and Wilson discuss Otis's vibes and playing multiple instruments.
Tape 7: Otis plays the music of Aretha Franklin, the Temptations, the Spinners, Bob & Earl, Irma Thomas, the Fiestas, the Moonglows, Wilbert Harrison, and Fontella Bass.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): John Patton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Aretha Franklin, Temptations, Spinners, Bob & Earl, Irma Thomas, Fiestas, Moonglows, Wilbert Harrison, and Fontella Bass.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Fontella Bass, Dizzy Gillespie, Impressions, Little Milton, Louisiana Red, James Brown, Marvin Gaye & Tammi Terrell, and Lil Green. Otis and Patton talk about James Brown.
Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Lil Green, Duke Ellington, Wynonie Harris, Percy Mayfield, Drifters, and Joe Tex. Otis and friends take phone calls.
Tape 4: Otis and friends take phone calls. Otis plays the music of Little Walter, Jimmy Nelson, Johnny Otis, LaVern Baker, and Paul Kelly.
Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Paul Kelly, Ella & Buddy Johnson, Louis Jordan, Elmore James, Bobby Parker, Count Basie, Jimmie Lunceford, and Ray Charles.
Tape 6: Otis plays the music of Ray Charles, Katie Webster, Wilson Pickett, Barbara Lynn, Alan Toussaint, Otis Redding, Joe Turner, and Amos Milburn. Otis promotes upcoming blues gig.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Songs About Animals
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Brad Pie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Joe Turner, Howlin' Wolf, Ravens, Jr. Walker & the All-Stars, Slim Green & the Cats from Fresno, Johnny Otis, Little Junior Parker, James Brown, and Louis Jordan.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Louis Jordan, Preston Love feat. Shuggie Otis, Smokey Robinson & the Miracles, Johnny Otis, Little Walter & the Nightcats, Joe Swift, Coasters, Count Basie, and Jackie Wilson. Brad Pie talks with Otis and plays guitar.
Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Jackie Wilson, Major Lance, Jewel Akens, Tampa Red, and Slim Harpo. Otis and friends take phone calls.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Slim Harpo, Duke Ellington, Muddy Waters, Jackie Lee, Taj Mahal, Bobby Day, Inez & Charlie Foxx, and Rufus Thomas. Otis and friends talk about their favorite animals.
Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Rufus Thomas, Big Mama Thornton, Louis Armstrong, Rosetta Crawford, Coasters, Otis Redding, Wilson Pickett, Lee Dorsey, Chuck Berry, and Big Maybelle.
Tape 6: Otis plays the music of Big Maybelle, Tony Allen, the Clovers, Clarence "Frogman" Henry, Charlie Parker, Amos Milburn, Joe Williams & Sonny Boy Williamson, and Bo Diddley.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Songs or Artists with Plants in their Name

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Eddie Floyd, Percy Sledge, Clovers, Big Joe Turner, Etta James, Cadets, Louis Armstrong, Fats Waller, Booker T. & the MGs.
Tape 2: Otis plays the music of the Coasters, Fats Domino, Gladys Knight & the Pips, Count Basie, Ivy Anderson, Chuck Berry, Ray Charles, B.B. King, Willie Mabon, and Louis Jordan.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Louis Jordan, Billie Holiday, Marvin & Johnny, Brenton Wood, Jr. Walker & the All-Stars. Otis and friends discuss racism and blaming minorities for America's social ills.
Tape 4: Otis and friends take phone calls. Otis plays the music of Wilson Pickett, Johnny Otis, Little Miss Cornshucks, Harlemaires, Hazel Scott, and Little Richard.

Tape 5: Otis plays the music of the Meters, Nutmegs, Richard Berry, Ben E. King, Velvelettes, Cleo Brown, Charlie Parker, Baron & the Blue River Band, John Lee Hooker, Maceo Woods, and the Raspberries. Otis talks about Cleo Brown.
Tape 6: Otis plays the music of Maceo Woods, Raspberries, King Curtis, Herb Jeffries, Johnny Otis & Eddie Vinson, Preston Love feat. Shuggie Otis, and Ray Charles.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Songs with Women's Names in the Title

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Little Richard, Lionel Hampton, Clovers, Tampa Red, Fats Domino, Little Jr. Parker, Big Maybelle, Larry Williams, and Ray Charles.
Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Ray Charles, Drifters, Charlie Parker, Chuck Berry, Big Joe Turner, Fats Waller, Louis Jordan, Johnny Otis, and Eddie Vinson.
Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Eddie Vinson, Joe Liggins, Mills Brothers, Swan Silvertones, Billie Holiday, and Johnny Otis feat. Ramona. Live performance with Ramona, Brad Pie and Shuggie Otis.
Tape 4: Live performance with Ramona, Brad Pie and Shuggie Otis. Otis plays the music of Brother Bones, Buster Brown, T-Bone Walker, Professor Longhair, Ike & Tine Turner, and Stevie Wonder.

Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Stevie Wonder, Hank Ballard & the Midnighters, Bobby Day, Nat Cole, Jimmie Lunceford, Lloyd Price, Wilson Pickett, Don & Dewey, Olympics, and B.B. King. Otis and friends talk about women they would like to run for President.
Tape 6: Otis plays the music of B.B. King, Charles Brown, Four Tops, Young Jessie, Coasters, Otis Redding, Duke Ellington, Ravens, and Leadbelly.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Etta James, Sam & Dave, Lionel Hampton, Four Deuces, Little Junior Parker, Fats Domino, Son House, and the Monotones. Otis and friends talk about the lack of a blues radio station.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of the Monotones, Muddy Waters, Count Basie, Brook Benton, Aretha Franklin, Clyde McPhatter & the Drifters, and Charlie Byrd. Otis and friends talk about Black artists getting cheated out of royalties, Charlie Byrd, the roots of jazz, and Sly Stone.
Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Sly Stone, B.B. King, Johnny Otis, and Little Willie John.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Jimmy Reed, Howlin' Wolf, Hank Ballard, Bessie Smith, Joe Tex, Fats Waller, Duke Ellington, Bobby Bland, and Billie Holiday.

Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Billie Holiday, Ray Charles, Martha & the Vandellas, Barbara Lynn, Louis Jordan, King Curtis, Sweet Inspirations, Flamingos, Jackie Wilson, and Charles Brown. Otis and friends talk about what they were doing in 1952.
Tape 6: Otis plays the music of Charles Brown, Big Joe Turner, Johnny Otis feat. Little Esther, Marvin Gaye, Bobby Marchand, Louis Armstrong, Solomon Burke, and Ruth Brown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Barrett Strong, Sticks McGhee, Big Joe Turner, Coasters, LaVern Baker, Ben E. King, Sensations, Shirley & Lee, Jimmy Reed, Ikettes, and Ray Charles.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Ray Charles, Count Basie, Fats Domino, Aaron Neville, King Curtis, Howlin' Wolf, Otis Redding, Sam & Dave, Koko Taylor, Etta James, Fontella Bass, Big Mama Thornton, Billie Holiday, Ella Fitzgerald, Lil Green, Dorothy Love Coates & the Gospel Harmonettes, and Aretha Franklin.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Aretha Franklin, Mary Lou Williams, Duke Ellington and Ivy Anderson, Gladys Knight, Marvelettes, Supremes, Little Esther, Shirelles, Dinah Washington, and Ruth Brown. Live performance of unidentified blues song by Brad Pie. Otis tells how the song "Double Crossin' Blues" came to be.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Ruth Brown, Ike & Tina Turner, Johnny Otis, Louis Jordan, Big Maybelle, and Don & Dewey. Otis and friends take phone calls.

Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Don & Dewey, Wilson Pickett, Four Tops, B.B. King, Muddy Waters, Booker T. & the M.G.s, Maurice Williams & the Zodiacs, Jimmie Lunceford, Clyde McPhatter, Lee Dorsey, and the Spaniels.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Brad Pie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of the El Dorados, Fats Domino, Lavern Baker, Parliaments, Johnnie Taylor, Lloyd Price, Ray Charles, Betty Wright, and King Floyd. Otis promotes upcoming concerts.
Tape 2: Otis plays the music of King Floyd, Frankie Lymon & the Teenagers, Little Richard, Joe Tex, Fiestas, Johnny Otis, Wilbert Harrison, Frankie Ford, and Bobby Marchand.
Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Frankie Ford, Bobby Marchand, Jay McShann, Dizzy Gillespie, Aretha Franklin, Otis Redding, Robert Parker, Lee Dorsey, Highway Q.C.'s, and the Swan Silvertones.

Tape 4: Otis plays the music of the Highway Q.C.'s, Swan Silvertones, Lester Young, Big Mama Thornton, Howlin' Wolf, Muddy Waters, Ann Peebles, Jr. Walker & The All-Stars, T-Bone Walker, and B.B. King. Live performance of unidentified blues songs by Brad Pie. Otis discusses his son Shuggie learning to play the guitar.

Tape 5: Live performance by Brad Pie. Otis plays the music of Clyde McPhatter, James Brown, Spaniels, Sam Taylor & Dick Hyman, Alberta Hunter, Louis Jordan, Billie Holiday, Bo Diddley, and Jackie Brenston.
Tape 6: Otis plays the music of Jackie Brenton, Al Green, Bobby Bland, Eddie Vinson, and Johnny Otis. Otis and friends take phone calls.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Ray Charles, Swan Silvertones, Aretha Franklin, Jimmy Reed, Bobby Bland, Gladys Knight & the Pips, Four Tops, Johnny Otis, Count Basie, and Muddy Waters. Live performance of "Baby What You Want Me To Do" by Otis and Brad Pie.
Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Muddy Waters, Koko Taylor, Clarence Henry, Little Milton, Mar-Keys, Etta James, Charles Brown, Sonny Boy Williamson, Moonglows, Lowell Fulson, and the Drifters.

Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Lowell Fulson, Drifters, Jimmie Lunceford, Louis Jordan, Wilson Pickett, Otis Redding, Bo Diddley, Little Richard, T-Bone Walker, Big Joe Turner, and Buddy & Ella Johnson.
Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Buddy & Ella Johnson, Oscar Peterson & Clark Terry, Ike & Tina Turner, and Little Willie John. Otis and friends take phone calls.

Tape 6: Otis and friends take phone calls. Otis plays the music of the Coasters, Chuck Willis, Slim Gaillard, Dinah Washington, Bo Diddley, Professor Longhair, Five Satins, Silhouettes, James Brown, and Little Sister.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Brad Pie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Chuck Berry, Eddie Vinson, B.B. King, Lionel Hampton, Marvelettes, Big Joe Turner, Ernie K-Doe, and Buster Brown.
Tape 3: Otis plays the music of James Brown, Jimmy Reed, Duke Ellington, T-Bone Walker, Ray Charles, and Aretha Franklin. Live performance by Brad Pie.

Tape 4: Otis takes phone calls, promotes Southern California Blues Society's black-tie ball, and plays the music of Otis Redding, Little Richard, Temptations, Brook Benton, Andy Kirk, Louis Jordan, and Jackie Wilson.
Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Louis Jordan, Jackie Wilson, John Lee Hooker, Billie Holiday, Little Willie John, Jimmy McCracklin, Bobby Charles, Al Green, and Booker T & the M.G.'s.

Tape 6: Otis plays the music of Booker T & the M.G.'s, Lavern Baker, Coasters, Count Basie, Fats Waller, Elmore James, Clovers, Johnny Otis, Big Maybelle, Allen Toussaint, and Alvin Robinson. Live performance by Brad Pie.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Billy Vera, Brad Pie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Louis Jordan, Jimmy Reed, Lionel Hampton, Otis Redding, Wilson Pickett, Dinah Washington, Little Walter, Temptations, Cadillacs, and the Soul Stirrers.
Tape 2: Otis plays the music of the Soul Stirrers, Sam & Dave, Johnny Otis, Big Maybelle, Bobby Bland, Bo Diddley, Lou Rawls & Diana Reeves, Aretha Franklin, Ben E. King, Joe Tex, and Guitar Shorty.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Guitar Shorty, LaVern Baker, Paul Gayton, Jessie Belvin, Percy Mayfield, Jimmy Liggins, and Maxwell Davis. Otis and Vera talk about Paul Gayten, Otis's upcoming book, Jessie Belvin's "Dreamgirl," Percy Mayfield's "Hit the Road, Jack" demo, Jimmie and Joe Liggins' styles, the music scene on LA's Central Ave., great jazz musicians who can play the blues, and Maxwell Davis's "The Flying Dutchman."

Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Maxwell Davis, Annie Laurie, Roy Milton, Count Basie, Lou Rawls, and Percy Mayfield. Otis and Vera talk about the beginnings of rhythm and blues music in LA, the artists involved, the country blues scene in Oakland, Percy Mayfield, and Lou Rawls.

Tape 5: Otis and friends take phone calls. Otis plays the music of Arthur Conley, Little Richard, Billie Holiday, Little Willie John, and T-Bone Walker. Vera talks about forming The Beaters, Tom Dowd, and polka recordings. Otis and Vera discuss Little Richard's commercial appeal, Gene Nobles' radio show, and Otis writing the song "Wishing Well."

Tape 6: Otis plays the music of T-Bone Walker, Drinkard Singers, Johnny Otis, Clifton Chenier, and Lee Dorsey. Live performance segments featuring Johnny Otis with Brad Pie [and Billy Vera?]. Otis and Vera discuss "Harlem Nocturne," the Excelsior label, the Drinkard Singers, and Clifton Chenier's "Pretty Girl."

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Guitar Shorty, Brad Pie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Fats Domino, Nellie Letcher, Carla Thomas, Willie Mabon, Aretha Franklin, Sticks McGhee, Bobby Bland, Buddy Ace, Don & Dewey, Johnny Otis, Billie Holiday, The Bobbettes, Chuck Willis, Curtis Mayfield & The Impressions, Ray Charles, The Harmonizing Four, and Louis Armstrong. Otis promotes his show's upcoming gigs.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Louis Armstrong & Ella Fitzgerald, The Temptations, Ann Peebles, Memphis Slim, John Lee Hooker, Guitar Shorty, Ruth Brown, Lee Dorsey, Tyrone Davis, Count Basie, and Duke Ellington. Otis and Shorty talk about Shorty's upcoming concert, his new album, and "Mean Husband Blues." Otis takes phone calls, conducts call-in ticket giveaway, and talks about the bands he has played with.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Mervyn Dymally, Ken McKnight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of LaVern Baker, Shirley & Lee, Booker T. & The MG's, Jimmie Lunceford, Count Basie, B.B. King, Charles Brown, Sly & The Family Stone, Joe Tex, Koko Taylor, Elmore James, and Albert King. Otis and Congressman Dymally talk about the first time they each met Charles Brown, Central Avenue in the 1940s and 1950s, the changes in Black music and the Black community, being scammed by independent record labels, and promote Otis's upcoming book.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of The Coasters, Otis Redding, Johnny Otis, Aretha Franklin, Eddie Floyd, Curtis Mayfield & The Impressions, Little Richard, Robert Johnson, Jimmy Reed, Drifters, and Lightnin' Hopkins. Otis promotes upcoming gigs, takes phone calls, and talks to McKnight about New Orleans.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Lightnin' Hopkins, Little Esther & The Johnny Otis Show, Etta James, The Rasberry Singers, Billie Holiday, Louis Armstrong, Fontella Bass, Duke Ellington, Bobby Bland, Guitar Slim Green, Slim Harpo, and Johnnie Taylor. Otis talks about Little Esther, conducts ticket giveaway.

King, Hank Ballard, Staple Singers, Duke Ellington, Ray Charles, Drifters, Sly & The Family Stone, Archie Bell & The Drells, Coasters, Howlin' Wolf, Otis Redding & Carla Thomas, Sam & Dave, and Al Green.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Al Green, Aretha Franklin, Lowell Fulson, Little Miss Cornshucks, Count Basie, Billie Holiday, Temptations, Jackie Wilson, Joe Tex, Delta Rhythm Boys, Earl King, Four Tops, Bobby Bland, Maurice Williams, and Clovers. Otis takes phone calls.

Otis talks about the lack of care and compassion in society today and the impact it has on those who are less fortunate.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Bennie Moten, Billie Holiday, Fats Domino, Lee Dorsey, Chuck Jackson & Maxine Brown, Wilson Pickett, and Ike & Tina Turner. Otis and Zeke talk about Zeke's giant compost pile, organic gardening, and environmentalism before taking phone calls.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: New Orleans Music
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Robert Walker

scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Joe Houston, Fats Domino, Shirley & Lee, Huey "Piano" Smith, Champion Jack Dupree, Carla Thomas, Chuck Berry, and the Moonglows.
Tape 2: Otis plays the music of the Clovers, Roy Hamilton, Sam Cooke, Etta James, Saunders King, Dixie Cups, and Danny Baker.
Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Ernie K-Doe, Snooks Eaglin, Smiley Lewis, and Louis Jordan. Otis tells stories about Louis Jordan and talks to Walker about his research on Jordan.
Tape 4: Otis plays the music of Louis Jordan, Lee Dorsey, Irma Thomas, Jessie Hill, and Aaron Neville. Otis and friends take phone calls.

Tape 5: Otis plays the music of Aaron Neville, Louis Armstrong, Professor Longhair, Frankie Lymon & the Teenagers, Little Willie John, Clarence Henry, Robert Parker, and Ivy Anderson & Duke Ellington. Otis and Ken McKnight talk about the New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Festival.
Tape 6: Otis plays the music of Duke Ellington, Johnny Otis feat. Delmar Evans, Johnny Otis, Ray Charles, Jimmie Lunceford, Amos Milburn, Joe Turner, and Johnny Ace.

King, Billie Holiday, Count Basie, Jimmie Lunceford, Aaron Neville, and The Drifters. Otis talks about Aretha Franklin, Jackie Wilson, and promotes an upcoming B.B. King concert.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Little Richard, Big Joe Turner, Clyde McPhatter, Clovers, Lionel Hampton, Fats Waller, Preston Love & Shuggie Otis, Temptations, Al Green, Irma Thomas, John Lee Hooker, Duke Ellington, Nat King Cole, Robins, Chords, Fiestas, and Harptones. Otis talks about local blues radio shows.

King, Little Willie John, Moonglows, Albert King, Louis Jordan, Muddy Waters, and Elmore James. Otis promotes upcoming gigs and talks about racism in America.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Guitar Shorty, Irma Thomas, Marvin Gaye, Otis Redding, Dinah Washington, Ray Charles, Chuck Willis, Lester Young, Billie Holiday, Johnny Otis, Stevie Wonder, and Aretha Franklin. Otis promos a Blues Society concert then talks about his upcoming concerts and his band's lineup.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Dewey Terry, Jimmy Espinoza, Tim "Zeke the Sheik" Dundon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Junior Walker & The All Stars, Hank Ballard, Erskine Hawkins, Wilson Pickett, Little Willie John, Jimmy Reed, Sam & Dave, Chuck Berry, Mills Brothers, Lowell Fulson, Art Tatum, Bobby Bland, Etta James, Richard Berry, Lil Green, Jackie Wilson, Temptations, John Lee Hooker, and B.B. King. Otis talks about Erskine Hawkins, Etta James, the upcoming Blues Society concert, and the state of jazz and blues festivals today.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Dorothy Love Coates, Billie Holiday, Don & Dewey, Count Basie, Helen Humes, Howlin' Wolf, Muddy Waters, Midniters, and Bo Diddley. Otis and Terry talk about their new albums, who wrote "Koko Joe" and "I'm Leaving It All Up To You." Otis and Dewey talk about the Squires, the old days, Otis's TV show, and Dewey's influences. Otis and Jimmy Espinoza (of Thee Midniters) talk about R&B, early Midniters hits, the song "Whittier Boulevard," love ballads, and Chicano covers of R&B songs. Otis and Tim "Zeke the Sheik" Dundon talk about conservation and environment issues, cooperating with nature, and Zeke's giant compost pile.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: "Double Play" night
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Billy Vera, Ed Pearl

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of The Clovers, Ray Charles, Little Esther Phillips, Big Mama Thornton, Louis Armstrong, and Fats Domino. Otis and Pearl talk about the Ashgrove Theatre and an upcoming Pete Seeger concert. Otis and guests talk about artistry in past music and comedy, the problems with TV, and homogenization of many ethnic styles in the arts. Otis talks about President Bush and healthcare in the U.S.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of The Midnighters, Gladys Knight, Lowell Fulson, Otis Redding & Carla Thomas, Coasters, Alvin Robinson, Fats Waller, Count Basie, Nat King Cole, J. Otis, Dinah Washington, Percy Mayfield, Delta Rhythm Boys, and Duke Ellington. Otis and guests talk about cover versions, commercialism, their favorite composers, and Harlan Leonard.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Billie Holiday, Count Basie, Chuck Berry, Drifters, B.B. King, Joe Turner, Marvin Gaye, Ravens, Floyd Dixon, Temptations, Jackie Wilson, Fats Domino, and Lee Allen. Otis, Tim "Zeke the Sheik" Dundon and local college students talk about Zeke, his giant compost pile, and environmental issues.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of King Curtis, James Brown, Floyd Dixon, Drifters, Ray Charles, Aretha Franklin, Jimmy Reed, and B.B. King. Live performance by Otis, Dixon, Espinoza, Pie, and Nicky. Otis and Dixon talk about the changing audience for the blues and when they first met.

scopecontent.p: Tape 1 (EC 10 2513): Otis plays the music of The El Dorados, Albert King, Mar-Keys, Clifton Chenier, Clyde McPhatter, Ruth Brown, Ben E. King, Coasters, Brook Benton, Lucky Millinder & Sister Rosetta Tharpe, Nat King Cole, Temptations, Stevie Wonder, Johnny Otis, and Louis Jordan. Otis talks about putting The Coasters together. Otis and Rim talk more about Otis's new album and working together in the old days.

Tape 2 (EC 10 2514): Otis plays the music of Muddy Waters, John Lee Hooker, Ray Charles, Aretha Franklin, Ernie K-Doe, Lee Dorsey, and previews tracks from his new album, Spirit of the Black Territory Bands.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Earl Bostic, LaVern Baker, Billy Preston, Donnie Hathaway, Clifton Chenier, T-Bone Walker, Johnny Otis Show, Sam Cooke, Billie Holiday, and Count Basie. Otis and friends take phone calls.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Shirley & Lee, Little Willie John, Don & Dewey, Eddie Vinson, Ben Webster, Hank Ballard & The Midnighters, Drifters, Aretha Franklin, Tyrone Davis, Willie Mabon, Washboard Sam, Teen Queens, Lionel Hampton, Fats Domino, Clarence "Frogman" Henry, Ray Charles, Otis Redding, Duke Ellington, Mills Brothers, B.B. King, and Jimmy Reed. Otis and friends talk about music today vs. African American music in the past.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Otis Career Retrospective
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Tom Morgan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of The Drifters, Jimmy Reed, Chuck Berry, Jimmy Nelson, Big Maybelle, T-Bone Walker, Sam & Dave, Don Covay, Nat Cole & Johnny Mercer, Ray Charles, Stevie Wonder, Junior Walker & The All Stars, Albert Ammons & Meade Lux Lewis, Elmore James, and Little Milton. Otis tells stories about Big Maybelle and how T-Bone Walker convinced Otis to start singing, about playing with Albert Ammons, Meade Lewis, and Pete Johnson, and then introduces a recorded interview he did Armed Forces Radio.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of J. Otis, Aretha Franklin, Otis Redding, King Curtis, Billie Holiday, and Edmond Hall. Otis talks about how he got started in music with "Count" Otis Matthews and other bands, his first recordings (including "Harlem Nocturne"), his band's first tour, the shift towards smaller R&B combos, the Barrelhouse, and meeting Little Esther Phillips. Otis and Morgan talk about Otis's upcoming album.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Muddy Waters, Big Joe Turner, Count Basie, Billie Holiday, Leonard Bernstein, Ray Charles, Marvin Gaye, Martha & The Vandellas, Hank Williams, Bo Diddley, Charlie Parker, Ella Fitzgerald, Elmore James, Bobby Bland, Drifters, and Percy Mayfield. Ken McKnight promotes a benefit concert for medical shipments to Trinidad and Tobago.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Louis Jordan & J. Otis, Fats Domino, Etta James, Chuck Berry, Jimmy Reed, Smokey Hogg, B.B. King, Aretha Franklin, T-Bone Walker, Bob Crosby, Coleman Hawkins, Stevie Wonder, Four Tops, Jerry Lee Lewis, and Little Richard. Otis talks about energy conservation and composting biodegradable materials.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Billy Vera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Big Joe Turner, Fats Domino, John Lee Hooker, Jimmie Lunceford, Little Willie John, B.B. King, LaVern Baker, Dizzy Gillespie, Chuck Willis, Staple Singers, Don & Dewey, Frankie Lymon & The Teenagers, and Rascals. Otis and Vera talk about Art Blakey, Vera's TV bandleader job, Black territory bands, playing at the Apollo Theater, and Frankie Lymon.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of The Coasters, Moonglows, Otis Redding, Percy Mayfield, Elmore James, Clyde McPhatter & The Drifters, Todd Rhodes, Ruth Brown, Robert Johnson, and Billie Holiday. Otis and Vera talk about Duke Ellington and Bonnie Raitt.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of The Mills Brothers, Duke Ellington, Fontella Bass, Ben E. King, Junior Walker & The All Stars, Sam & Dave, Curtis Mayfield & The Impressions, Edwin Star, Earl Bostic, Johnny Otis Show, Charlie Parker, Billie Holiday, Paul Kelly, Mar-Keys, Muddy Waters, John Lee Hooker, Joe Liggins, and Frank Culley.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Richard Berry, Ray Charles, Jessie Hill, John Lee Hooker, Coasters, King Curtis, Aretha Franklin, Stevie Wonder, Jimmy Ruffin, Lee Allen, Little Willie John, Nat Cole, Art Tatum & Ben Webster, Otis Redding, and Howard Tate.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Tom McElhaney

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Inez & Charlie Foxx, Four Deuces, Big Jay McNeely, Bull Moose Jackson, Ivory Joe Hunter, Wilbert Harrison, Big Mama Thornton, Hank Williams, Dinah Washington, Soul Stirrers, Billie Holiday, Joe Turner and Wynonie Harris, and T-Bone Walker. Otis and friends chat about Ivory Joe Hunter, how Bull Moose Jackson got his name, meeting Hank Williams in 1950 and how many African Americans are country western music fans, especially in the South.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of The Ikettes, Jay McShann & Walter Brown, Katie Webster, Brenton Wood, Lester Young, Martha & The Vandellas, Stevie Wonder, Jackie Wilson, Sonny Boy Williamson, Mercy Dee, Fats Domino, and Young Jessie. Otis talks about working with Lester Young, about going to jail and police brutality, then chats with friends about Celtic art, cultures, and Dorothy Donegan.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of Hank Ballard & The Midnighters, Etta James, Chuck Berry, June Richmond, Elmore James, Marvin & Johnny, John Lee Hooker, Big Maybelle, Fats Waller, Spiders, Richard Berry, Slim Harpo, Monotones, El Dorados, Aretha Franklin, and Jesse Belvin. Otis promotes an upcoming gig.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Girl Vocal Groups Night
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Ray Campi

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Muddy Waters, Howlin' Wolf, Billie Holiday, Fats Waller, Sweet Inspirations, Bukka White, B.B. King, Supremes, Martha & The Vandellas, Janettes, Chiffons, Huey "Piano" Smith, Ernie K-Doe, Sixteens, Laura Otis, Shondells, Bobbettes, Teen Queens, Otisettes, Staple Singers, Shirelles, Patti LaBelle & The Blue Belles, Bunny Siegler, Billy Stewart, and Aretha Franklin. Otis takes phone calls and chats with Ray Campi about rockabilly and Rose Maddox and her upcoming gig.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Ray Charles Special
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Bob Kinnard, Tony Segunda

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Ray Charles, Ben Webster, Clifton Chenier, J. and Shuggie Otis, Roy Hamilton, Sam & Dave, Charles Brown, Preston Love, Marvin & Johnny, Bo Diddley, Lloyd Price, Duke Ellington and Louis Armstrong, and T-Bone Walker. Otis talks about the Berkeley Farmer's Market, the Ecology Center, and radical vegetable gardening with Kinnard and Segunda.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Ray Charles, J. Otis with Ramona, Ruth Brown, Sonny Criss, and Little Willie John. Otis talks more with guests about growing trees, organic gardening, composting and chickens.

Tape 3: Otis plays the music of the Impressions, Jay McShann, Jack McVea, Johnny Ace, Mary Wells, Paul Williams, Lucky Millinder, Marvelettes, Little Milton, Louis Jordan, Billie Holiday, Ella Fitzgerald & Louis Armstrong, Clyde McPhatter, John Lee Hooker, Coasters, Martha & The Vandellas, and Jimmie Lunceford,

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Bobby Bland, Ike & Tina Turner, Otis Redding, Count Basie, John Lee Hooker, Ray Charles, Lightnin' Hopkins, Midge Williams, Muddy Waters, Slim Gaillard, and Aretha Franklin. Otis talks about his upcoming all-day radio show fundraiser, Dizzy Gillespie, having a second chance at life and enjoying the good things.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Jimmy Reed, Percy Mayfield, Spirits of Rhythm, Professor Longhair, Martha & The Vandellas, Bill Doggett, Elmore James, Chuck Berry, Dizzy Gillespie, Billie Holiday, Johnny Otis, and Tony Allen. Otis talks about Leo Watson and the Spirits of Rhythm.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Duke Ellington Special
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Charles "Sumo" Schofner, Dr. George Curtis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Martha Reeves, Temptations, Ray Charles, Duke Ellington, Aretha Franklin, Otis Redding, Blind Willie McTell, John Lee Hooker, Slim & Slam, El Dorados, and Jimmy Reed. Otis talks about touring experiences, the birth of his daughter, and Duke Ellington with Charles "Sumo" Schofner.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Sam Cooke, Prof. Alex Bradford, Duke Ellington, Lou Rawls, Little Willie John, Little Walter, Bobby "Blue" Bland, Staple Singers, and Lightnin' Hopkins. Otis talks about Native American land use, trombone playing, and Charles "Sumo" Schofner's upcoming performance.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show: Big Bands and Blues

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of Roy Brown, Count Basie Orchestra, Professor Longhair, Champion Jack Dupree, Jimmy Witherspoon, Little Willie John, Duke Ellington, Louis Armstrong, Jimmy Reed, Willie "The Lion" Smith, Z.Z. Hill, Saunders King, Jimmie Lunceford, and Lionel Hampton. Otis talks about health issues, sustainable agriculture, and gardening.
Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Snooks Eaglin, John Lee Hooker, Howlin' Wolf, Otis Redding, Al Simmons, B.B. King, Dorothy Donegan Trio, and Staple Singers. Otis talks about stories from his book.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Sandy Miranda

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Part 1: Otis plays the music of Camille Howard, Betty Everett, Jerry Butler, King Curtis, Charles Brown, Coasters, Penguins, Guitar Slim, Charlie Rich, Isley Brothers, Champs, Tony Allen, and Four Tops. Otis talks about his health, finding Mel Walker, Coyote Point Museum for Environmental Education, and Latin and Black relations.

Part 2: Otis plays the music of Marvin & Johnny, Jimmie Lunceford, Dells, Lowell Fulson, Impressions, Louis Jordan, Hadda Brooks, Chuck Berry, Little Willie John, and Johnny Ace. Otis talks about Hadda Brooks and the annual Blues and Jazz Concert at Dunsmore.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Frank Riley

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Part 1: Otis plays the music of Lloyd Price, Bobby ""Blue"" Bland, Katie Webster, Soul Stirrers, Lightnin' Hopkins, Marvin Gaye, Arthur ""Big Boy"" Crudup, Otis Redding, Lula Reed, and Aretha Franklin. Otis talks about the origins of the term jazz and listening to Gene Nobles and Randy Wood's radio shows while touring.

Part 2: Otis plays the music of Ray Charles, Big Joe Turner, Little Miss Cornshucks, Otis Redding, Sarah Vaughan, Smokey Robinson & The Miracles, and John Lee Hooker. Otis talks about Little Miss Cornshucks, Little Miss Sharecropper, Otis Matthews and the hand jive rhythm, artwork featuring women and Strom Thurmond."

Otis, Chuck Willis, Little Richard, Ray Charles, Sam Cooke, Rufus Thomas, Clifton Chenier, and Sam & Dave. Otis and Tillery discuss her New Spirituals project and upcoming concert in Oakland with Vocal Motion. Otis discusses racism and health topics with Dr. Curtis. Thomas Nash, assistant publisher of The Post, talks to Otis about upcoming story on deejays and programmers.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Otis discusses the death of Albert King, Otis Matthews, and Clarence Van Hook's father. Live performance by Van Hook in memory of his father. Charles Brown announced as guest but does not seem to be included on this tape.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Delores Hawkins & the Hambone Kids, Shirley & Company, Bo Diddley, Dee Clark, Howlin' Wolf, Soul Stirrers, Sam Cooke, Dinah Washington, Slim Gaillard, Cadets, and Johnny Otis. Otis discusses cooking with Bonnie Simmons, the Save the Seniors foundation with Clarence Van Hook, and greets Josh Elwood.

Hill, and Roberta Flack & Donnie Hathaway. Otis and Van Hook talk about alcoholism and their new organization, Save Our Seniors. Otis talks about gardening and soul food.

Otis, Furry Lewis, Little Walter, Koko Taylor, Betty Everett, Art Neville, LaVern Baker, Clifford Chenier, Dinah Washington, Bobby Marchand and the Isley Brothers. did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Clarence Van Hook, Tim Mueller, Tom McElhaney

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Cannonball Adderley, Esquires, King Curtis, Slim Galliard, Toussaint McCall, Little Arthur Matthews, Jimmy Reed, Huey Piano Smith, Chuck Willis, Joe Turner, Koko Taylor, Mills Brothers, Willie Mabon, Brenton Wood, Brownie McGee, Lavern Baker, Dinah Washington, Curtis Mayfield, Bessie Smith, Stevie Wonder, B.B. King, Duke Ellington, Guy Lombardo, Ray Charles, and Billie Holiday. Otis talks with organic farmer Tim Mueller and blues musician Clarence Van Hook gives a live performance of "West Texas Blues."

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show
did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Clarence Van Hook, Ronald Wilson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Aretha Franklin, Thurston Harris, Koko Taylor, Count Basie, Pete Johnson, Martha & the Vandellas, Jimmy Reed, LaVern Baker, Howlin' Wolf, Clovers, Impressions, Jimmy Wilson, Ray Charles, Duke Ellington, Silhouettes, Mary Wells, B.B. King, J. Otis, and Art Tatum. Otis discusses racism in Middle American, politics, religion, anti-abortion movement, anti-semitism, gay rights and women's rights, and speaks with a representative from the local farmer's market. Blues musician Clarence Van Hook gives a live performance accompanied by Ronald Wilson on clarinet, and they chat with Otis about music, fishing, and a local Black cowboy rodeo.

King, Duke Ellington, Count Basie, Martha's Monkey, Jimmy Witherspoon, Clifton Chenier, LaVern Baker, Mills Brothers, Billie Holiday, Tampa Red, Jimmy Reed, Bobby Bland, Sonny Terry & Brownie McGee, and Z.Z. Hill. Blues singer-guitarist Clarence Van Hook performs live. Otis talks with young track star Daveeta Shepherd.

King, Duke Ellington, Bobby Bland, Jimmy Rushing & Count Basie, Charlie Parker, Staple Singers, Little Richard, Clarence Garlow, Jimmy Reed, El Dorados, Little Milton, Dinah Washington, Mills Brothers and Little Walter. Clarence Van Hook gives a live performance of "Precious Lord."

scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Inez Fox, Peppermint Harris, Lightnin' Hopkins, Otis Spann, Dinah Washington, LaVern Baker, Lee Dorsey, Fats Waller, Clyde McPhatter, Professor Longhair, Little Walter, Clovers, Champion Jack Dupree, Bessie Smith, Mary Wells, Aretha Franklin, Mills Brothers, Bobby Bland, Elmer Lee, and Jessie Belvin. did.abstract: Featured guest(s): Theodis Ealey, Clarence Van Hook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Otis plays the music of Mickey & Sylvia, Otis Redding, Shirley & Lee, Clifton Chenier, Dells, Aretha Franklin, Smokey Robinson, Wilbert Harrison, Dinah Washington, Ruth Brown, J. Otis, Memphis Slim, Fats Domino, Bobby Bland, Ben E. King, Etta James, and Z.Z. Hill. Clarence Van Hook performs live. Otis and Theodis Ealey talk about Little Esther, racism in Mississippi, traveling on the Chitlin' Circuit, and play tracks from Ealey's latest album.

Otis discusses the Persuasions, Shuggie Otis' band, playing with Art Tatum, biointensive organic gardening, and talks with a coordinator of the Girl Scouts about their upcoming events.

did.unittitle: The Johnny Otis Show

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Otis plays the music of John Lee Hooker, El Dorados, Otis Redding, Smokey Robinson & The Miracles, Little Walter, Slim & Slam, Muddy Waters, Professor Longhair, Lowell Fulson, Little Richard, Jerry Butler, Little Milton, Nat King Cole, Ruth Brown, and Art Tatum. Otis talks about the Sebastopol Apple Blossom parade and his chickens.

Tape 2: Otis plays the music of Martha & The Vandellas, Temptations, Ray Charles, Duke Ellington, Aretha Franklin, Otis Redding, Blind Willie McTell, John Lee Hooker, Slim & Slam, Elmer Lee Thomas, El Dorados, and Jimmy Reed. Otis talks about an onstage goof he pulled in the early days of his career as well as humorous mistakes his band has recently made. Otis and guests talk about upcoming shows and Otis talks about his philosophy on helping panhandlers.
